All Reviews

  1. Love this! My skin has cleared up in only a week thanks to this handy tool.
  2. Great scrubber...soft, but cleans deep into your pores.
  3. Works well. Received in Avery timely fashion!
  4. This is really good product
  5. I love it, but it's a little harsh for my older skin, so I use it maybe once every 2 or 3 weeks.
  6. Great for using once or twice a week, be careful not to over-exfoliate as it will exacerbate any trouble spots. Overall very glad I purchased this instead of a much more expensive Clarisonic. For the record, I bought this over a year ago and it is still holding up.
  7. Used it for a week and did not notice much of a difference between the brush and just using my hands and an exfoliant. It does feel really nice on the face and the brush is soft, I have never tried a Clarasonic so not sure how it stands up. I used the Olay exfoliator that came with it once and then stopped as I have really sensitive skin and it seemed a bit drying. I just used my Dermalogica Daily Microfoliant with it and it seemed okay, but no better or worse than the regular old own-two-hands method, which can cover a much larger area making the face-washing process a lot quicker. Maybe you need to stick with it longer to see any noticeable results? I don't have acne but have always had issues with small bumps along my jawline and more recently, randomly on my forehead. In the past I have had great results with glycolic peels but they can be expensive and I was looking for a cheaper exfoliating alternative. Maybe it doesn't have the power needed to make a difference in my particular case. For the price it was worth a try, maybe it will work for you.
  8. good for its price, if it is provided with a lithium battery it would have been better
  9. sux specially if you have the clarisonic like i do. i bought this bc i left my clarisonic at my other house and I just needed something to hold me over until then. Also if your hair gets stuck in it it'll tangle it up and hurts so bad.
  10. Tried multiple batteries and did not turn on. Very disappointed.
  11. We bought one in a store and after 3 years it finally died. I haven't tried the expensive brushes but this this thing is incredible. It has two speeds and the brushes are surprisingly soft. Best thing to have in the shower after a long day.
  12. Really nice feeling!! Since it is much cheaper than other similar products, it is really a good deal!
  13. I researched this product before buying it, even to the point of watching several videos on you tube comparing it to the much pricier Clarisonic Mia 2. This product is small, lightweight, and fits nicely in your hand to operate. It is extremely gentle on your face; it feels like feathers on your skin, especially gentle on the sensitive skin around your eyes. I don't care for the Olay Cleanser that was enclosed, so I have been using it with a drop of anti-aging body wash or even Noxema for a gentle massage and clean. I wish the unit was even bigger so I could use it on other areas of the body. This is a well designed product that I like so much I am thinking of getting one for my daughter and another for her mother-in-law! I saw the same unit on sale at CVS for $29.99, so getting it from Amazon for $18.99 (after applying a $3.00 coupon which they provided!) was a steal. This product was definitely worth the price and I highly recommend it. It did cause a breakout on my chin the 2nd week of use (haven't had a pimple in many years! ) but this is a common side effect due to my skin not used to being thoroughly cleaned and massaged like this. Nothing has happened since, and it cleared up in a few days.
  14. Love this. For the price, it does everything I need it to do.
  15. This works ok,my fave is too sensitive for this though, makes my skin sore to touch and raw.
  16. I have always wanted to tey the clearsonic, because so many people rave about the product. But i always thought olay catered to more gentle youthful skin, so i came across the pro x and decided to five it a try........LOVE IT!!!!!! Good thing i tried it. Cleans my face like nothing else. I would say to anyone who wants to try one of these cleansing system without spending alot of money on clearsonic, go ahead and try the Pro X
  17. It was fine. I expected higher speed.
  18. I actually liked the way this worked on my skin, but it died after 6 weeks of use. Junk. I will invest in something that will last longer this time (but just in case . . . I'm keeping the box & all the packing).
  19. I ended up out of town unexpectedly, without my Clarisonic. I order this one on Amazon as a stop gap, and being a Prime member, it arrived promptly in two days. Batteries went in easily (contrary to another review), BUT I couldn't get the brush head to snap on. I called the company, and the representative was very nice. Still, she couldn't do much more than read the directions. After a certain amount of (unsuccessful) discussion, she said she could mail me a coupon within the next 2-3 weeks to buy another one locally. Not only am I out in the middle of nowhere, but I'm not going to be out of town that long. So not a good solution. I did get this brush to work, though the brush head wasn't totally snapped on. If it works like this when snapped on properly (and I expect it does, it could just come off more easily), then I would say it doesn't do any more than a soft face brush that you could use manually. Get yourself a Clarisonic already. Its only problem, imo, is that the brush heads have to be replaced every 3 months, unless you figure out a way to keep them disinfected--there are some diy tips about that on the web, btw.

  35. This product works well for me. I have combination/oily skin, with a mixed race background, and am 30 years old. I just think that our skin is advancing with our diversity and so should the way we wash and handle it.<br /><br />I have been using this Olay brush for two months now, once a day before bed with an acne wash, and I can say that my skin has not felt this good since before puberty hit. I still break out a little, but now the acne goes away so quickly and without too many extra harsh chemicals used afterwards. My pores are visibly smaller. My mother, a natural redhead with bright green eyes, was sitting next to me and told me how beautiful the pores on the side of my face looked, and immediately demanded I buy her a brush. She now uses it and is also pleased with how soft her 54 year old skin feels. I recommended this brush to my cousin who has similar genetic makeup as I, recently. She came by last week and said she doesn't know how she lived this long without it (so dramatic at age 20).<br /><br />I feel like some of the negative reviews I have read were by people who used the brush once or twice and seeing no difference stopped using it and threw it away with a scathing review here. It urged me to add my success story to the growing list. You have to use the brush everyday, for a period of time to really see a difference. It doesn't magically make your skin over in one or two uses, but it does cleanse deeper than your fingers. It also matters what you do after you cleanse. Do you use toner to remove excess cleanser? Do you use appropriate moisturizers and creams for your skin type?<br /><br />I recommend this brush for any type of woman, of any age. Or anyone with problem skin for that matter.<br />Thank you for your time, if you've read this far! :)read this far! :)

  93. I'm a skincare nut and shell out top dollars for high end cleansers but never felt the need for a cleansing brush - wrote it off as a lazy-man's device...what, you can't manually scrub your face for 2 minutes each day?! I came in here looking to check out Olay's Va Va Voom cleansing system, and instead found this little gem! For 20 bucks with a 3 dollar discount coupon, it was a no-brainer.<br /><br />I'm in my early 30s with oily skin. Have periods of time when I get \\"You're glowing\\" and other times when its sallow and lifeless or extra greasy with open pores.<br /><br />When I first opened up the kit, I was kinda disappointed that the brush head bristles were so soft - Thought what the hell is this little head going to clean that I cant get out of my washcloth. Maybe its supposed to be this \\"soft\\" - remember this is your face we're talking about, not a kettle pot. Plus with the rotating motion of the brush, I feel you're getting a good CLEANSING action (maybe not enough exfoliating...if you're like me and used to more abrasive exfoliants)<br /><br />I tried the brush with the sample cleanser provided and you really feel you're getting a face massage or facial. Its just another level of cleansing - better, more thorough, and able to reach that tricky corner where your nose meets your face. I felt cleaner and more refreshed after one time with this brush than I have in years. You do need to be careful about using it too close to the under-eye area as it can feel like its tugging or pulling on that gentle skin.<br /><br />My only complaint with this kit is - like the other reviewers said - the battery compartment and how difficult it is to get that thing to open for the first time. Believe me, I read all the pointers about \\"gently rocking it from side to side\\" and even watched videos of how to install batteries in this thing...yet, NOTHING! Just when I was almost in tears and ready to give up, boom, it comes open. And once it was open, the second and third time I tried opening and closing it, it opened up really easily with no problem at all. I think you need to be a little rough with it - don't be afraid its gonna break or crack open (even if its made in China). And persevere through the first time. It gets easier the next time round.<br /><br />The cleanser sample is good but nothing special, so I am glad I didn't buy the other version of this kit with the full size cleanser - Instead invest that money and buy yourself some replacement heads.<br /><br />Its been a week since using this nifty gadget (on and off with the Olay cleanser). I use it twice a day - morning on the low setting and before going to be on the high and then layer on a thick moisturizer. Am happy to report my pores are smaller, skin is smoother than ever, and skin is definitely back in the \\"you're glowing\\" category. Thanks so much, Olay!<br /><br />Highly recommended! Try it - you'll be pleasantly surprised! Definitely will buy again.

  113. OK, I'm sure this product is meant to be used for microdermabrasion--anti aging stuff, but for me, this is FINALLY a solution to a life-long battle with clogged pores. I always thought that at some point my age would cause a shift in my oily skin and I'd stop having to battle blackheads and breakouts, but this wasn't in the cards for me. The good thing about an oilier complexion is my skin is younger looking than most of my contemporaries (thanks Arbonne too!), but the bad thing is enlarging pores and ongoing battles with clogged pores. Biore strips (forget it!), scrubs, masques, on and on. What is working the BEST of everything (including ProActive) is this little brush and a mild cleanser. No more going after my pores causing redness and scarring. I use this twice a day and my pores are clear and SHRINKING! Woo hoo!! The other thing I use is Origins facial micordermabrasion scrub, Modern Friction. I have the clearest complexion of my life and my skin is getting more youthful all the time. I can't give this brush all the credit for youthful skin waaaaaay after 40. But add this to an anti-aging skin care line that works for you (Arbonne RE9 for me) and I think you'll be pleased. I LOVE that this is waterproof. Although I use mine at the sink, it's nice to know it's not going to burn out because it got wet. Highly recommended. Also, a great exfoliating scrub with good lotions (Arbonne again, folks) would prevent the need for a big old machine that goes into the shower to sand the skin as this product is being compared to--yikes that sounds like a lot of work and maybe even dangerous!
  114. Being over Fourty, you can imagine how many gadgets, creams, potions and promises I have tried. Spending a ridiculous amount of money on my disappointing quest to find something, anything that did what it promised and actually WORKED. Seeing the Pro X Cleansing Brush in an add in one of my magazines, I came on-line to see if it was anything like it's other counterparts. Thrilled about the price. (not $150.00 like it's competition charges) I figured I had nothing to loose. I have always trusted the Olay brand. After all. My Mother has used Oil of Olay for 50 years and looks amazing. I should have listened to her when I was 16. But as women do, we get sucked in by 'the next great product guaranteeing the Fountain of Youth' I'm happy to say...my journey has ended. In a short week I have seen such a huge difference in the condition of my skin. It's so incredibly soft. My Complexion is even and I'm starting to see the fine line DISAPPEAR. I have even gotten complements from friends, asking me what I have done different. And I'm happy to tell both them and all of you. This is your miracle. One more thing. I have to add that the exfoliating cleanser sample that os supplied is unbelievable. It's the combination of the two product that make this the best Cleansing System Ever. I'm back to order some of the moisturizers. I have high hopes for this line. Thank you Oil of Olay. You have a customer for life.

  117. I generally don't rely on other reviews to choose products but when I was looking to buy something I had never used before, I read many reviews before deciding to purchase this product. They were very helpful so I wanted to add mine in an effort to pay it forward. I am very happy with this product. It also arrived on time and as described. As I age, my facial skin has developed a very specific dry T-zone and I could never moisturize enough. I finally decided to invest in a cleansing tool and unlike other reviewers, I found both speeds helpful. I tried the slower speed first to acclimate it to my face and was glad I did. It refreshed my face, getting rid of old skin and made moisturizing much easier. It lasted longer as well. The higher speed does an excellent job of cleasing my face in the winter as it tends to get dryer then. I would recommend this product to anyone on the fence about buying a cleansing tool.
  118. On the bottom of the instrument, below the gray off and on buttons and the line, are words Olay Professional. That is the part that comes off to install batteries. Hold the brush part down with one hand and pull with the other hand. It's tough but it will come off. Do not pry with anything, you will scar up your brush. They really should have included instructions for this! [[ASIN:B0043OYFKU Olay Professional Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System]]
  119. I bought this in combination with the Olay microdermabrasion kit to address some skin issues I have been noticing lately including fine lines, brown spots, and breakouts. I investigated both the Olay Pro-X and Clarisonic as possible purchases, but decided on the Pro-X based on user reviews and price. I am glad I purchased the Pro-X as I really like this little cleaning tool. It is gentle enough on my face to use once a day at the end of the day and it leaves my skin feeling very soft and clean. I use it in the shower without a problem. Since starting to use it I have seen improvement in the overall look of my skin and I have had fewer breakouts. In combination with the microdermabrasion kit I have seen reduction in fine lines and brown spots as well although I think most of that is due to the microdermabrasion kit not the Pro-X. I have seen other people mention concerns about the battery compartment, but I did not have issues with the batteries to get started (have not had to change them yet). I got the Pro-X while on sale on Amazon about 6 weeks ago and I am very happy with the purchase. I gave it 4 stars because I don't have the benefit of having tried another similar product to objectively evaluate the differences.

  123. I normally wash my face in the shower by wetting a washcloth, rubbing some Dove sensitive bar soap on it, then adding a tablespoon or so of baking soda. I smush that all together and massage my face with it. It leaves my skin nice and clean and smooth. When I purchased this Olay cleansing brush, I wondered if it could clean better than a washcloth using either the Olay cleanser that comes with it or my Dove/baking soda combination. I do not think it does. I do like it, though. It's a nice size: a little shorter than my hand and just a bit wider than the width of two fingers. It was very easy to pop out of the box, snap the brush on, insert the batteries that come with it, push the button and use. I think it is fun to use it and it feels nice on my face. If you can spare the cash to purchase this, great. If not, grab a washcloth, your favorite cleanser, some baking soda - and you probably have a pretty fair match.

  125. Products being compared. Names copied from products' pages on Amazon. \\"CONAIR CORPORATION Facial Sauna Systems with Timer\\" \\"Olay Prof Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System\\" & The ideal piece would be combining the Olay's brush and the Conair's mechanics. Brushes: Conair - I didn't know how hard the brush is until I used the Olay's. Conair's is like those FIRM toothbrushes. Olay-Olay's is twice as soft as the SOFT toothbrushes. Mechanics: Conair - Love it! Olay's - A lot slower than Conair's. Conair is like a nice sports car going 70 mph. Olay is like a sedan going at 30 mph at top speed. Olay has 2 speeds. Conair has only 1; on/off. Batteries: 2A's Conair - Cover slipped right off Olay - I tried and haven't been able to open the battery compartment yet. I read a post on here of how to do it but I'll have to scroll through to look for it. I already tossed the box. Even though I still own both, because the Conair's brush is too rough, I only use the Olay until I find one that has the Conair's mechanics and a brush that's NOT as soft as the Olay's.
  126. This thing reminds me of those people you see shining the floor with those industrial buffers.<br /><br />I will start by saying, I am not a woman, but I can see this thing being more useful to them with the make up.<br /><br />I was looking for some face cleaning products when I ran across this. Read a few reviews and it seems a good price and way to clean my face.<br /><br />I will say, it doesn't make my face feel tingly fresh like a lot of face scrubing lotions do, but I do believe that this works better than just using your hands to rub your face.<br /><br />The battery compartment is a bit tough. So don't assume you can just use any face lotions with this mini buffer.<br /><br />It has a rough feel to it. I have yet to try using this prior to shaving. Hopefully it will help to make my rough facial hair a bit looser and easier to shave, hence the main reason I purchased this product.<br /><br />A word of warning...be careful using this thing. Once things start getting lathered up and juicy wet on your face this product can start winging some high velocity rogue droplets right into your eyeball.<br /><br />So try and keep your eyes closed if your getting close to them.<br /><br />If you're a chick you might really like this thing. I'm sure I can live without it. But the true test will be the shaving aspect I mentioned. But still, the added benefit to the shaving aspect isnt anything to boast about. Just helps out a little. That is the only time I use this product now.   137. I'm not a gadget person but I really, really like this. It fits nicely in the hand, it has 2 speeds, and the brush feels just right-not too rough or too soft. I use this brush 1 to 2x a day. It keeps me honest in the fact that I believe that this brush allows me to get my money's worth out of the other products that I use, by really getting to and exposing the skin's surface. I dab an exfoliator and cleanser on my face because I found that if I put them directly on the pad and then turned it on, the stuff immediately flew off all over the place. I do believe that the brush coupled with my cleanser and exfoliator really penetrate deep to allow for the most clean, blank canvas, enabling the other products to do their thing. In the morning, I use an exfoliating scrub and a cleanser. I dab both in several spots all over the face, wet the brush pad, and wash with the spinner all over, from forehead to neck. (I then follow up with my serum->moisturizer->SPF->makeup routine.) In the evening, I do the same thing with the spinning brush and exfoliator/cleanser combo (followed up with retinol->moisturizer). I truly believe the brush does a better job at enabling products to clean the skin better than a washcloth. I quickly found that my makeup looked better, it wasn't sitting on dead, flaky skin (sorry, I know, gross). No doubt my $$$ anti-aging products are better able to do their job, too.

This brush paired with a great moisturizer has completely solved the problem, almost immediately! I also have occasional acne and this has also helped with blemishes as well! I use the cleansing brush with my prescription face wash. Sometimes I put the cleanser directly on the brush head and other times I rub the cleanser into my skin with my hands first and then go over it with the brush. Both ways seem to work great!   156. I had been on the fence about whether this was worth all of the hype I had been reading, but then decided if it works half as well for my skin, then it would be a good purchase. Well, I have to say, it does a wonderful job of getting deep down into the pores- no need to apply pressure, just let the circular soft brush do it's thing. Having naturally oily skin, I noticed a significant difference the very first time I used it. My skin felt less congested, less oily, my pores seemed less noticeable, and my makeup went on more smoothly. It did not, however, leave it feeling parched or overly dry--just extra clean. I think this could be good for those with dry skin as well, as the dead skin and gunk can be thoroughly cleansed away thereby creating no barrier to your moisturizer application, letting your skin drink it right up! It takes just a few seconds more in the shower to go over your face, a few extra more to go over your neck. But, that's well worth it when you consider the payoff of better feeling, better looking skin. I can best describe it this way, it's like going from a manual toothbrush to an electric toothbrush. You think your manual toothbrush is just fine, until you see how great and clean your teeth feel after using an electric toothbrush for the first time--it's a big difference and worth the splurge. I highly recommend the Olay Professional Pro-X Advanced Cleansing Brush.<br />I did not use the included sample of exfoliating cleanser, as I have no desire to switch from my tea tree soap for cleansing and jojoba oil for moisturizing/balancing.

  189. I was considering getting a Clarisonic but since they are quite costly I decided to shop around for some cheaper options and I came across the Olay Pro-X. After unboxing the Pro-X I was disappointed by how chinsey it felt in my hand even for an $18 item, I was still excited nevertheless to try it out and reveal my magically lovely skin. Putting the brush onto the unit did not give a confident click or lock, so I repeated the action several times just to make sure it was actually in right.<br /><br />I was washing my face at the bathroom sink so I held the Pro-X to my face and turned it on... immediately there is water and face wash flying off the brush in all directions, including into my eyes and mouth & all over the bathroom (this went on for the duration of my face washing). I continued using the product with one eye cracked open a tiny bit & mouth sealed shut tightly. Because of the spinning motion of the brush, it propels itself in unruly spirals around your face that are rather difficult to redirect which gives a similar feeling to being dragged behind a dog on a leash. I had used a headband to hold back as much of my hair as possible at my hairline after reading in the instructions that you cannot use the brush too close to your hairline or it will twirl your hair into dreadlocks. I tried to keep the brush away from my hairline, but that results in a 1 inch perimeter around my face that is impossible to clean. I edged in as carefully as I could in an attempt to bridge this gap, and surely enough I ended up with wet facewash frothy hair twirls -admittedly my fault for even trying.<br /><br />This device has a mind and agenda of it's own and I felt like I was fighting it and losing. After I finally finished washing my face I felt this sense of relief, like I had narrowly escaped a hurricane & was finally safe in my underground shelter. I rinsed my face expecting to feel baby soft skin after the ordeal I went through but my skin felt just as dry/rough as before, only with additional redness & irritation now. I disappointedly rinsed the brush head & gave the device a shake to release some water from the brush when what else.. but the brush head flies off the device and across the room.<br /><br />All in all the device is garbage, the user experience is horrendous, and it is not worth your money. A washcloth can do a better job cleaning and exfoliating your face than the Pro-X can, and it is certainly less messy & traumatic. On the bright side, my terrible experience with the Pro-X sent me right out to purchase a Clarisonic which I have been using for several months now and highly recommend.
  190. I bought this after trying my friend's Clarisonic system. I wanted similar brush but didn't want to spend as much money. Olay had OK review so I decided to go with it. Olay isn't too bad, but the brush head can be little harsh on dry sensitive skin, and the rotating motion makes it harder to reach sides of nose.<br />Clarisonic gently vibrates and its brush is softer and finer. It is significantly better quality compared to Olay. Olay's only advantage is price. ($20 vs. $100) I have pretty OK skin that withstands Olay's rotating brush and scrub, so I had a good result with Olay, but if you have a sensitive skin and extra $100 to spend, get Clarisonic.<br />About the small tube of exfoliant that comes with the brush: It is probably too harsh for most people. I use &#34;Alba Botanica Acnedote&#34; scrub instead of scrub that comes with the brush.
  191. Oh my goodness I cannot say enough great things about this brush. My esthetician recommended I purchase a spin brush to exfoliate better and specifically recommended the Olay system instead of Clarisonic because she thinks they are overpriced. I am gonna buy that woman a great Christmas present this year! My skin is ultra smooth and soft, I am already seeing a difference after only one week of use. Compact and convenient, it fits great anywhere and will be easy to travel with over the holidays. I am never parting with this!

I've used the product that comes with it and also one that I always used, and never had any problem with either causing any irritations. My face feels clean and fresh after I use it. I've been having problems with sporatic acne recently (I'm almost 30) and so far my skin seems so much clearer. I would recommend more or less holding the product still and letting it do the work as you move it over your face (versus also moving your hand around, which I have an inclination to do).   219. I just received the cleaner and used it once. I wanted to post a review because I had no problems installing the batteries as others have reported. The instructions on the box say to gently rock the battery compartment cover from side to side while pulling with the same hand. In doing this the cover came off within seconds. I was expecting a battle involving a butter knife in the crevice, but didn't need it. The brush didn't seem to lock in place very securely but it didn't wobble or come loose with use. I applied the cleanser to my face with my hands then used the cleaner. I didn't get any splatter, as I saw in some reviews. It seemed much gentler than I expected, but that's probably best on the skin. After the first use my skin feels clean. I did use it for longer than I probably will on a regular basis, but I imagine with regular usage it will do a decent job of exfoliating. I can't compare it to the more expensive models as I haven't tried them. For the money I think I'll be content with it. I will post an update after a few week of usage, I'm hoping it'll clear, and keep clear some pores that seem to stay clogged and therefore look larger.

  235. I don't own the fancy Clarisonic thing that this imitates, but based on owning this, my advice would be do it right (and cough up the three-figure amount for the real deal) or don't do it at all. I don't see any improvement in blackheads, and the friction actually seems to exacerbate blemishes. I would give it two stars, but I'm giving it three in the interest of fairness: You're only supposed to use it for 60 seconds, I think, but that goes by quite fast and I've probably used longer on many occasions. If you tend to be a little obsessive, you risk damaging your skin.<br /><br />I've also since learned that skin problems -- at least of the oil/blackhead/zit variety -- have more to do with what's going on in your skin than on your skin. As in, blemishes are caused by oil you produce, not dirt/dirtiness sitting on your face. More abrasive and thorough cleansing have psychological appeal, but the ingredients in cleansers (salicylic acid etc) are more important. Certainly you want to thoroughly remove your makeup, and a brush like this may help, but you have to remember that you're going to reuse that brush.

  248. I have sensitive skin, so I'm always a little leery to try new face products, but I've had good luck with Olay in the past (their regenerist moisturizer is awesome - and for those wondering, I use the products at acne-dot-org usually. Work great!)<br /><br />I thought I'd give this little gizmo a try when I realized that apart from the occasional actual scrub, I don't ever scrub my face when I wash it. I wash it by hand, splash dry, and then pat dry with a washcloth. So I thought this gadget might help get rid of some places (around the nose and chin) where I get clogged pores (not pimples, not blackheads usually - just clogged pores. You can run your fingernail across in a certain way and they ooze out, but you can't see them unless you're investigating your own face in the mirror).<br /><br />Since you can't use this on your eyes of course, I decided to use it in the AM instead of in the PM when I need to remove makeup. It's shower-proof, so you can use it in the shower. I really like using it in the AM - it's a nice little wake-up to scrub your face a bit with it (the same reason I sometimes like to use body scrub in the AM) and get the blood flowing. It has 2 speeds, but I honestly can't really tell a difference with it. The scrubby brush is VERY soft and not scratchy at all. And of course you can use it with the Olay scrub or another of your own, but I wouldn't use it with anything very coarse.<br /><br />Does it work? Well, it feels good. I've been using it for several weeks in this very dry winter and have noticed a couple dry spots that feel a little better. The clogged pores are maybe a little better off, though it's nothing amazing.<br /><br />Would I recommend? Eh, maybe. You'd probably get jut as much out of the non-battery powered scrubby tools that some other cleansers come with. With those, you wouldn't have to worry about replacing batteries or changing the scrubby bit (you can buy replacements), because the scrubby is generally on the package when you buy it. It feels nice and I like it and will continue using it, but I can't really tell you to run out and get one right now. For the retail price, it's not that amazing. And I can't help but feel that it's a trendy thing, and you won't be able to find those replacement heads forever. I mean honestly - it's a soft, spinning brush. We're not talking about anything revolutionary here!ike it and will continue using it, but I can't really tell you to run out and get one right now. For the retail price, it's not that amazing. It was my first ever exfoliating facial brush and is just a cheaper alternative I wanted to try out before saving up to buy myself a Clarisonic. I usually have a lot of dead skin lurking on my face after I get out of the shower, but I started using this in the shower almost every day (big points for being waterproof!). The Pro-X makes my skin super smooth and not only that, but I feel it deeply cleanses my skin, which is great, because dead skin is another contributor to pimples. If you're just looking for a quick fix to the radiance your skin lacks, then the Pro-X is great for the job. It's also petite so it's really easy to travel with. The only con about this product is that it might not have the high pressures and DEEP cleaning that Clarisonic has, but for $20, you save a lot more on something that is almost as good!
  265. For this price, it is good. I haven't try the sonic one, but the performance of this is good enough for your daily cleaning. And the free clean gel is good.
  266. I started using this on a every other day basis because sometimes my skin can get over-dry if I use a more powerful face wash, especially in the colder months. Even though I don't use it every day, it's worked well in clearing up my skin. Like a lot of other people, I get those pesky blackheads on my nose that are hard to get rid of. But using this gets rid of them and has kept them away. It's even prevented any bigger pimples from sprouting up. My skin is a lot smoother and softer as well. The bristles on the brush work well. They are hard enough to clean your skin well but soft enough that it won't rub your skin too hard and make it red. Although the cleanser works well, I might use my regular cleanser instead of buying a new bottle of the Olay. I haven't quite decided.<br /><br />My biggest problem was getting the part where the battery goes in open. I tried for at least 10 minutes on my own and eventually had to ask someone else to help because I was too frustrated. I understand that it needs to be waterproof but there has got to be an easier way to have a waterproof battery part and still be a little bit easier for the consumer to get it open.<br /><br />But overall, I really like the cleansing system and would recommend it to anyone who doesn't want to pay too much to get a good face cleansing system.
  267. I am not impressed with this product at all. I was looking for a product that would provide cleansing but also remove the dead skin cells that accumulate and cause lines and wrinkles. What a let down! I would not recommend this product to anyone. I am glad I bought an extra head for the hand held device so I can try to sell this hyped up product to some other unsuspecting consumer and recoup some of my money. My advice, don't bother. Save your money.
  268. I'm 19 years old and still wondering why I have acne. My friend told me I wasn't washing my face enough. Well.. In fact I was washing my face day and night. So I thought I'll give pro-x a try. The first time I try this, it made my face clean and glow! It also save time in the morning because you only should use it for 2 minuets. But I highly recommend to use a good moisturizer. Some times I wash my face too long because it feel so good that my face hurts when I put toner on. So be prepared to have a good moisturizer!   275. After reviewing the comments from previous users, i decided to purchase the olay cleansing system. I love it. I use it daily along with the olay cleanser.
  276. Beauty devices like the Olay Professional Pro-X Cleansing System are most accurately reviewed after an extended sampling by the reviewer. Unfortunately, I am a very disorganized person and wont be able to log my opinions for that long. Therefore, I'll edit this review as my experience with this product evolves. First impression: This contraption is rather small. It will travel easily. There is a fair amount of heft to it and, in my opinion, the device is well-built and perfectly capable of surviving a tumble onto a hard shower floor. The battery compartment door can be a source of considerable frustration if, like many, you have a hard time prying it open, however I found that by using a wiggling motion and gripping with the heel of my hand, it comes off without too much trouble. The bristles are well designed. They strike a fine balance between being too gentle to do any effective cleaning and too harsh or irritating to the skin. The bristles are soft and short, which translates to a firm press with little give when applied to the face. I found the motor to be very adequate for the purposes this device was built for. I anticipate that unless you were to violently press this against your skin, the motor will not stall. Finally, the process of cleansing itself. I noticed that it was much harder to know which parts of my face I had passed over with the device already, due to both the small surface area of the brush and the lack of feedback for my hands. (I'm used to using my hands in conjunction with an exfoliating scrub.) In the end, though, I felt that my skin was definitely smoother and cleaner. Day 3: Improvement in skin, particularly around areas without a bony palette underneath, like my cheeks. Softer. Seems like my hands just weren't doing the trick. I've been using it daily and noticed slightly more dryness post-shower, but nothing bad. Moisturizer absorbs more quickly than before and offsets and additional dryness caused by this method of cleansing. 1 week+: After a little while, getting a little doubtful as to whether this is the best product for my acne. Face is softer, true, but it might be irritating. Not sure whether it is the brush or cleanser that I recently switched to. Not liking the condition my skin is in right now...
  277. I love this product<br />The brush is not abrasive but you feel it on your skin<br />My face glows after I use it.<br />It removes the oil, dirt or make up from the day.<br />I use it on my neck and chest area too<br /><br />It arrived sooner than advised and was packaged well
  278. I was so excited for this because it was so cheap. Now, I know why. First, the brush head is TINY. It spins and often falls off. The other cleaning tools clean in a more vibrating, sonic way. After 2 months, the thing just stopped working. For the same price, Amazon sells another item that is very similar.I think its called the Petrika or something. Also, the Sirius Sonic which is very comparable to the pricy Clarisonic is amazing and only $50. Save your money by avoiding this product and get something of quality. For $25 more the Sirius Sonic will actually last.
  279. I've been battling hormonal acne for a couple of years now. I recently determined part of the problem is my skin just doesn't slough off well enough, or quickly enough on its own. I bought the Olay Professional Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System because I wanted to try out one of these types of products, didn't want to spend a fortune (in case it didn't help), and the reviews on this site and others have been really positive. My skin has been better since using this product. I use it twice a day - when I wash my face in the morning, and again at night - sometimes the night cleansing will be with the brush, sometimes I use the brush with one of the two microdermabrasion scrubs I use 2 - 3x a week, after cleansing. It clearly works, as far as cleansing goes - I wash my face with cleanser and my hands first, then use an AHA wash afterwards with this brush, and you can see how much more make-up this product removes, that the actual cleanser missed (and I don't apply make-up with a trowel, either!). Nice to see that it really works, but gross to see how little is removed by using a cleanser and no brush. It keeps my skin pretty smooth, and flake-free (especially since I use the microderm and chemical peels at home), and I do think it has helped (along with the AHA products I've recently started using) with excess oil - just in the last month or so, even during hot, hot, hot AZ days, my skin hasn't been nearly as oily as it had been before I started using this. Even the \\"hormonal\\" oil that surfaces twice a month - before I started using this, during those times, my skin would feel thick, slick and rubbery, like a seal's. So gross. Now my skin is much more like it used to be - some surface shine, but nothing out of the ordinary. If it could just make the chin acne go completely away, I'd be over the moon, but that's more than what this product is made to do. Long story short, get it, I think you'll be happy with it. It's effective, but gentle - my skin has never been irritated by the brush. I'm still on the first set of batteries too, and it's been at least a month.
  280. Ordered this item on Sept. 23rd, it was shipped yesterday (26th) and I received it today, so the delivery time was great.<br /><br />I don't know what I was expecting but...this seems quite pricey ($26.00) for such a meager little piece of machinery. The way Olay describes the product you'd think a lab full of rocket scientists developed it!<br /><br />The battery compartment is EXTREMELY hard to open. After numerous tries, and using all my strength, I finally pried it off. I attached the brush head and turned it on just to see it \\"spin\\". It was a little wobbly. I thought perhaps I didn't insert it properly so I removed it and re-inserted it...same thing, wobble-wobble. Not a crazy lopsided wobbling but for $26 I feel the brush head should be balanced and sheesh, the renewal cleanser is close to $20!<br /><br />Anyhow, I used it for the first time tonight, along with a dime-sized amount of the small tube of exfoliating renewal cleanser that was included so...we'll see. I'm going to give the product a couple weeks and I'll be back to update my review. I do have to say though, the hand-held cleansing brush seems cheaply made.<br /><br />UPDATE: 10/30/11 Well...I really, REALLY wanted to love this product. Unfortunately, for me, it made my skin worse. I was always blessed with great skin. However, now that I'm older my skin has become extremely dry and sensitive. The brush and exfoliating renewal cleanser felt like I was rubbing sandpaper on my face. When I try to put any type of moisturizer on afterwards, it stings because it's so irritated. I also have red splotches everywhere. Not only that but my forehead and temples are so dry they're peeling. Also, my pores haven't gotten smaller and my face doesn't feel any cleaner after using this product than it does normally. Glad it's worked for the majority of users, I, unfortunately was not one of them :(

  286. I really like this cleansing device. I can't compare it to the Clarisonic since I don't have one but I'm pleasantly surprised at how clean it gets my face. A lot of the posts mention that it doesn't exfoliate - I use it with my regular cleanser and I do get some level of exfoliation. I had a problem with constantly getting a blemish right around my eyebrow area (likely from using waxy eyebrow pencils to define my brows). When I use the device to clean my face, I also lightly go over my brow area to remove any makeup. After the first couple of days of use, I noticed there were \\"flakes\\" in my brows- it was my skin exfoliating off from cleansing in that area. It fully went away after a couple additional days of using the cleansing device but it showed me that one of the reasons I may have been getting blemishes was because my skin was not being properly sloughed off in the area under the eyebrow hairs. Long story short, I like my skin more and more everytime I look in the mirror after using this and it seems my blemish spots are fading faster as well. And, the smallest benefit is perhaps the biggest... I work hard and I don't always have time to pamper myself. There is just something nice/luxurious about gently working the soft brush around your skin and I feel a little bit special each time I use it.

Since using the clarisonic my face is much clearer. My aestichian has said that since the clarisonic uses sonic motion it is gentle on the skin while cleansing, the olay pro x brush however, is too rough on the skin and brushes are not supposed to rotate because it is too agressive and creates micro-tears in your skin where bacteria can form..which explains my painful breakouts. I think that in the end the clarisonic is worth the investment.

  301. Ok, I am obsessed with my skin. Just because I rotate three toners, three cleansers, one exfoliator, three moisturizers and a night serum and use eye cream twice a day does NOT mean I have a problem! Preventive maintenance is the key! I was intrigued by this product and was excited to try it. It has a very soft bristle head that snaps on a shaft attached to the motorized body and comes with a tube of exfoliating cleaner. I opted not to use the Olay cleaner and swapped it for my regular exfoliator since the texture and odor were not amenable to me. You are directed to moisten your face, the brush head, and to rub the cleanser on your face. My thought was, why am I doing all the work? Nonetheless, I soldiered on and ran the brush over my face for a minute as directed. My face seemed shiny and polished, but it was also irritated despite the seemingly gentle rotation of the brush. I also had three red splotches on my forehead. I wasn't too pleased. Maybe using just a cream cleanser with the apparatus would lead to better results, but why not just use a washcloth and some vigorous scrubbing? Or for that matter, a toothbrush. This might be good for someone with oily and flaky skin that was not sensitive for high-level exfoliation. I personally felt like I had used a rotating sander on my face and need to use extra serum tonight.
  302. $30 to get $200 results? Yes, Please. I am a terrible skeptic. Still, I took a chance on a lightning deal and ordered this. I am so glad I did. Well in to my 40s, I still have oily skin, get pimples and have pores you could land a plane in. I wont tell you this gave me luminous, perfect skin overnight. However, I have been using this for over a month, and I have seen definite improvement. My skin is much cleaner looking, much smoother and yes, my pores are less noticeable. There are two speeds for the spinning brush head. I only use the higher speed. You don't have to push the brush down hard against your face to get results. It is easy to clean and fits in a nice, small organizer. The kit came with a trial size cleanser that helps exfoliate. I love the spa experience on my time and terms. This is definitely worth trying. It has taken me 30 years to find something to work on my pores. I love this. I use it three to four times weekly.

I do not use Olay's cleansing products on my face, rather those from my dermatologist, but it doesn't matter because the brush is great to use with other face cleansing products! I would recommend this product to anyone with minor to severe acne to help balance out your skin.   333. I purchased the Oil of Olay pro-X in lieu of spending $150.00 on the competition. An exfoliator by nature, I have used many differnet types of products to exfoliate, including, wash cloths, scrubs, buf-pufs, loofahs, etc. When I learned about this little gizmo, I thought I would give it a try as it was garnering such great reviews from the press and from actual users of a similar more costly product. I thought before I spend all that $$ on the $$$ model, let me try the Olay to see if I liked it. It was a very good price to deliver a similar effect that the expensive one does, and the reviews on Amazon pointing out the pros and cons are quite accurate. I do use it daily, it does not tear up my skin as one reviewer mentioned, it has two speeds, is easy to work, does not need the recharger which cuts down on it's size, can be left in the shower caddy, and was totally worth the money. I am glad that I tried the Olay first and as a result will not invest $150.00 on the original version of this cleansing system, as I cannot imagine it does that much more than the Olay does. It is the same principle, and as I mentioned as an exfoliator, all methods work as long as you are diligent, and know your skin type and how to exfoliate effectively without doing any damage. So if you want another way to exfoliate to change your beauty routine, the Olay Pro-X is a very nice addition to your cleansing routine, and it can be used with any type of cleanser or scrub, according to your skin type. Hope this helps!

  340. My husband purchased this product for me from Amazon three weeks ago and I've been using it 5-6 times so far. I am very happy with the results. My skin is much cleaner and the pores are finer even after the first couple of times. In addition, my skin looks brighter due to the fine exfoliation it provides. I am 33 (woman) and the skin on my face is mixed, normal to oily on the T-zone and very dry for the rest. I've noticed that it's better for me to use it longer on the T-zone and only superficial on the rest of my face; otherwise my face tends to get dry. I used the product about 3 times a week. I think more than that would be too much for my skin. I have used it both with the original Olay pro X cleanser (included) and with my regular face washer and I haven't seen any difference. Therefore I think the system works with any face cleanser whatsoever. The original cleanser has some micro-abrasive particles but I think the system's results are produced by its rotating motion and not by the cleanser. I prefer to use it at night before bed and after each use I apply a moisturizing cream. Although the brush is incredibly soft,it still provides a a nice refreshing massage to the face. I have not used other cleansing systems before but I have tried all kinds of face washing products with exfoliating power. None of the cleansers by themselves compare to using this system. It definitely is superior. The brush is recommended to be replaced after 3 months or sooner if it's worn-out. The product is very easy to use once you get the batteries in place. I had troubles identifying where the mechanism opens up to insert the batteries; there is not button to push it open, you just have to force down the bottom part of the handle. I had to have my husband do that because it requires a certain force (probably just for the first time). Overall, I'm very pleased with this product and I highly recommend it.
  341. I liked how easy this was to use. The brush applied the cleanser easily with no mess. I once used a similar system that had a sponge brush, which I didn't like because it was messy and seemed to use up a lot of cleanser. Using this one was no harder than hand-washing my face. The texture of my skin felt better and cleaner and I think my skin accepted the moisturizer better after using this to cleanse.<br /><br />Mostly, I liked how the brush felt on my skin--a nice gentle massage, something nice to do for myself each day. I feel like it did have an effect on my skin's texture, but even if it didn't, just the simple ritual of taking time to care for my skin in this way made it a joy to use.

  346. An excellent product. The battery case was ridiculously hard to get off. I'm pretty strong for a woman, but I couldn't get it myself. The brush is amazingly soft. I sorta braced myself to use it for the first time, but it actually feels like a wonderful little facial massage. I'm in my early-40's and have had hormonal acne since puberty. Prior to using the Pro-X, I've vacillated between using my fingertips with a pricey cleaner (never seemed to really clean that deeply) and a washcloth with a cheaper facial cleaner (cheaper stuff because the washcloth soaks up a lot of cleaner), which feels like a deeper clean. I thought the Pro-X would work well, but would be more time-consuming and inconvenient than my normal routine, and I was only half right. It left my face feeling and looking clean and exfoliated, but it wasn't any more difficult. The washing part took slightly longer because of the small brush head, but the time was more than made up by the much quicker rinse time. And it rinsed a lot cleaner than a washcloth does, too. So now I get the best of both worlds, with my higher-quality cleaner and my Pro-X. I was a little concerned about my long hair getting tangled in it, but so far that hasn't been a problem. The brush has gone over some long hair hanging down by my ears in particular, but the hair hasn't gotten tangled in the brush. I do push my hair back when I notice, though. A headband would solve that problem nicely. I actually look forward to my little mini facial massage at night, my face looks a lot better, and it's at least as convenient as my old wash cloth. I like it well enough that I'm considering purchasing one for my tween daughter.

  356. I'd say this product is best for unclogging pores and preventing blackheads. I have been cursed with large pores. I thought my exfoliating cleansers were doing a fine job with removing make-up and oils at night. I just figured my acne-prone skin had solely to do with hormones. It wasn't until I started using the Pro-X system that I actually realized how much of my make-up and oils remained on my skin after my nightly cleansing routine. My skin feels WONDERFUL immediately after using this, smooth and very clean. It's addictive. I use the more vigorous speed at night while removing make-up and then use the gentle slow speed briefly in the morning before applying moisturizer. My pores are definitely less clogged, although I still suffer from hormonal acne and my search for a miracle continues. Some quick notes about the product: 1. The heads last about a month or a little longer (with twice-a-day usage), before the bristles begin to flatten some. Mine didn't come with a replacement head and I wish I had bought that with my initial order to be ready. If you are not using it for make-up removal, the head would probably last longer and will definitely stay more clean. 2. Rinse well after using it. Run it on the fast speed for few seconds to shake off excess water and prop in an upright position to help it air dry. I felt the head lasted longer when kept clean and dry between use. 3. The head is a nice compact size great for cleansing beneath the jawline, behind the ears and neck, and on the temples. I can't compare this with similar products as this is the only one of it's kind I have owned, but I like this one so much that I'm not interested in trying any others yet. :) A quick note on cleansers: the sample that comes with the system is...eh - okay. It has fine beads in it for exfoliating (it doesn't suds at all if that is important to you). I really like Neutrogena Naturals Purifying Pore Scrub (but it doesn't get sudsy either). It doesn't contain harsh chemicals, dyes, or sulfates for those with sensitive skin issues.

  369. This is a decent quality spinner-scrubber. The scrubber is very soft and the soap sample that comes with it is nice enough. A few things though:<br /><br />1.) I wish the spinner went both ways, it just spins in one direction. Seems like I could get cleaner skin if it was a dual-spin head.<br /><br />3.) It takes WEEKS to see any changes, such as cleaner pores. Don't expect overnight glowing skin. I've been using it on and off for months now and don't see any change at all. Maybe I need to use it more, but like I said, with no directions, it's hard to know what's too much or too little.<br /><br />4.) The liquid cleanser isn't special at all, nor does it have an appealing smell. You could basically use your favorite skin cleanser with this and it would be just as good.<br /><br />5.) The batteries were SO HARD to put in. I'm normally good at stuff like this (think lots of kid toys with batteries), but it took my about 15 frustrating minutes to get them in, plus using a kitchen knife!<br /><br />6.) It's handy that this product is waterproof so you can use this in the shower.<br /><br />7.) You don't have to spend any more money after buying this product, unlike the Neutrogena Sonic Wave.   376. While waiting for my Pro-X to arrive, I read alot of comments regarding the brush head getting bent, flattened, or otherwise crushed during travel. After I got mine and used it the first time, I looked around the house and ended up making my own travel protector sleeve out of a (used) K-Cup - the bottom is the exact size of the brush head! Just tear off the papery K-cup top, pull out the filter and wet coffee grounds and wash the plastic cup out. Then use a sharp scissors tip to puncture the middle of the bottom and then cut-cut-cut round and round to get the right size hole. Then drop the Pro-X brush head down into the K-Cup and let the tip go through the hole you made and then stick it back on the Pro-X. It reminds me of when a dog has to wear one of those lampshade-looking things. Anyway, this temporary fix will do until I use up a little plastic container of mineral face powder. Actually this will work even better for travel so the brush won't take a beating inside a cosmetic case. At home I'll just let it dry in place with the Pro-X on its side.<br /><br />This is the first time I've ever used a gadget like this and I just love it. I was always a face scrubber so at first I thought it should feel stronger. Then my wise daughter reminded me I'm using an exfoliant gel and to just let the gel work around with the brush and do its job. I was really surprised how different my skin felt afterwards. The moisturizer went on and absorbed well instead of feeling like it was sitting on the surface. I haven't decided how often to use it but maybe every other day... we'll see. I mainly want my skin to look healthier rather than oily-flaky in places. With dead cells removed regularly and better utilization of the skin products, it should be right for my routine. This is far better than the puff kinds of exfolient pads we've all tried. Wow those were harsh even for a scrubber like me. May as well have used Lava soap on my face! Yikes!
  377. This is the best beauty purchase I made in 2011. Obviously most people can't talk about this without mentioning the Clarisonic, and I was torn between getting this and dropping $200+ on a Clarisonic Plus, and in the end decided to try this out. If it didn't work out, oh well, less than $30 lost. I've been using it ever since and it is absolutely fantastic. I have stubborn blackheads and enlarged pores on my nose and cheeks, and the results with this are fantastic.<br /><br />The Clarisonic does have additional options for different brushes, but I don't honestly see the need for that. I don't really need a special body brush, I use this all over. The replacement brushes for this are less than $10 on Amazon, whereas the replacement heads for the Clarisonic can be up to four times that much. It's no contest. Sure, I could buy the Clarisonic, it would look a lot prettier in my bathroom and it's a lot fancier and has more bells and whistles, but this little guy gets the job done and leaves me with lots of extra money for makeup and other goodies :)<br /><br />Update February 2013: I actually received a Clarisonic as a gift last year and didn't feel right leaving this review as it was. I have to say that the Clarisonic is better in every way, my skin feels completely different after using it. That doesn't take away from the cleansing capabilities of Olay's product -- yes, it cleanses well and I did see a difference in my skin, probably due to the light exfoliating effect and the thorough cleansing. Previously, I wouldn't even thoroughly clean my face every day(gross, I know), so I'm sure that's a factor when considering the efficacy of the Olay cleansing system. The difference with the Clarisonic is that it goes a step beyond that. I use it two or three times per week and my skin has a different glow about it. I break out less, my pores are visibly smaller, and I even find that makeup goes on more smoothly. So yes, for $20, the Olay cleanser is great, but if you're looking for the effects of the Clarisonic, this isn't a substitute.g for the effects of the Clarisonic, this isn't a substitute.

It has completely changed my skin, I had milia on my cheeks for yearsss and nothing could get rid of them. I changed creams, used scrubs, facial peels, etc. I even had extractions done by a facialist who only mauled my face and left scars that took months to disappear.<br />The Olay brush removed almost 100% of my milia in less than a month of 1x daily use.<br />My face is baby soft, I keep on feeling it and am amazed--my skin hasn't felt this soft or looked this good since high school<br />If it helps, I am 27 years old with combo skin and have been using this brush for at least 3 months now
  389. There is no holder for the cleansing system product as I would of brought another one that had it.
  390. Perhaps I expected too much, but this device seems to make no difference at all to the way my face feels after using it.<br /><br />It's a bit rough if you press too hard, but with gentle use feels just fine. I'm not a teenager with pimple or acne problems so perhaps it works better for them, I wouldn't know. For a middle aged woman it's just OK.
  391. I notice absolutely no difference after using this product, other than my skin feeling tighter in an uncomfortable way. I have large pores. They look exactly the same before and after exfoliating. I now only use this after a night out when I'm wearing more makeup than usual that needs to be scrubbed off.
  392. I love my Olay ProX cleansing system. I recommend the cleansing system to anyone who needs a deep penetrating brush.

Afterwards, my face feels refreshed( I use a toner after cleaning). When I use my moisturizer on my face,my skin feels smooth. I highly recommend.

  401. This should be a definite buy for anyone who's looking for facial cleansing products. You will not be disappointed.
  405. After wanting a Clairisonic for like 3 years, my husband bought me this instead. And I admit, it's not half bad! My face feels softer after using it, that's for sure. You can use pretty much any cleanser that you want, but exfoliating kinds work best. I wish the brush head had a higher speed, and that there were multiple brush heads, but it still does the job. I have never used mine in the shower, just at the sink, so I can't comment on that. I notice that while using it, it kind of splashes the face wash all over my face and the mirror, which can be a little annoying. Overall though, I'm glad I got this instead of spending that $130 on a Clairisonic.

Lucci had a larger buffer and cleansing wheel, but this smaller one is better. Love this! Small, comfortable in hands, waterproof and the sample Olay cleansing cream is good too. Once I use that up, onto the S. Lucci assortment. You won't go wrong if you choose this item.
  410. This is the best facial machine for the best price. It gets your skin soft clear and glowing will recommend to everyone I know!
  411. I debated endlessly about the Clairsonic, but the price held me back. I was about to spring for the CS when I found this Olay Pro-X recently at Costco....$36 for the device, a full 6 oz. tube of the Olay Pro-X exfoliating cleanser, an extra brush head, and 2 batteries. Seemed like a good deal. By the way, putting in the batteries isn't rocket science, it was quite easy! What I was looking for: an end to dry patches of flaky skin. I have good clear skin, but at 62 I have had endless problems with flaky skin. I also have very sensitive skin, so using a washcloth and also using the exfoliating cleansers so often in my attempts to control dry patches left me with red, irritated skin...and still flaky. Nothing seemed to help. I was worried that the CS or this one would leave me with very red, inflamed skin from the brushes and the cleansing action. Not so. Ten days of using this and there has been zero redness or irritation from its use, and my skin is smooth as silk and best of all, no more flakes or dry rough patches. I've always washed my skin carefully, but it has never felt this smooth and silky, I see a definite difference from using this. I didn't expect to like the Olay exfoliating cleanser (I've tried some of their other cleansers which were too harsh), but I really like this one...it's extremely mild with very tiny granules in a creamy base, but thus far I'm using it only every few days, no need to use it daily. My current favorite am/pm cleanser is Aveeno's ultra calming cleansing cream, which works wonderfully with this device. I use the Pro-X every evening, and occasionally in the morning on a dry spot here or there if I detect any sign of flakes anywhere. So using the Pro-X once a day is not too much when used with a gentle cleanser. You do not push the brushes into your skin; rather, you just let them barely touch the skin and slowly move the brush around. It feels wonderful....so much so that you don't want to stop! The brushes are incredibly soft, by the way. As for the two speeds, I don't see a huge difference in the two. The first, slightly slower speed might be better when using the exfoliating cleanser, and the faster one for just regular daily cleansers. But really, the difference in the two speeds is barely detectable if at all. And by the way, a couple of reviewers mentioned that this device flings water all over...absolutely NOT SO. I held it away from my face to see what it would do, and it didn't send any water anywhere at all. I can't imagine what these folks did to produce that effect! I can't comment on how long the batteries last yet. If they seem to go too fast, I may get the rechargeables recommended in an earlier review. I also can't compare to the Clairsonic. They do work differently, apparently. The CS vibrates very fast....I saw one in Sephora the other day and was able to turn it on. Its brush was very soft, and it didn't seem like it would be in the least bit harsh. The vibration of its bristles did seem different from Olay's device, which rotates in a circular direction rather than just vibrating. Somehow I think this rotation might work better for the flakiness issues, but I wouldn't really know unless I tried them both. However, at the Olay price point, I'm 100% happy with this product and I've stopped lusting after the Clairsonic, no need to spend that much money since I'm getting the results I want from the Olay. A final comment: You can over-do putting products on your skin, and you can increase skin problems because of what you are putting on your skin...overkill, if you will. I saw this for myself. In trying to stop the irritation, redness, dry patches and flaking, I was using too many products, and my skin was reacting to all these things. What ended up working best was gently cleaning my skin with very gentle no-fragrance cleansers (Cetaphil is fabulous, the Aveeno I'm using is as well), and avoiding harsh products because they are not needed. I found that less is more.
  412. Just as good as a Clarisonic.
  413. Size is small and handy even for people with big hands. Brush can be slightly bigger. The speed seems slow even on turbo but after a while, I got used to it.
  414. I received this as a Christmas gift from my sister. I was actually contemplating purchasing the Clarisonic cleanser after reading such great reviews from the beauty blogging community, but was hesitant because of the price. On a daily basis, when wearing makeup, I wipe my face with Neutrogena makeup removing towelettes, and then I use a face wash and rinse. Even so, I felt my face was not fully clean. I use the Olay cleanser in the shower, and it really makes my face feel super clean. My face is acne-prone and I use an acne prescription, Differin, which regenerates the skin with new skin cells, so I can't exfoliate everyday since it would be too harsh, although I wish I could because it makes my face feel amazingly clean and soft. My forehead had a bit of cystic acne but it's all cleared up since I've started exfoliating. I'm glad I hadn't purchased the Clarisonic, it might work better - never tried it, but I'm not complaining about the Olay cleanser so I'm satisfied with this.
  415. After extensive research on the Clarisonic (both the Pro and the Mia), I opted for the Olay Pro-X. I figured for under $30, even if I hated it/it broke/the batteries died, I wouldn't be out more than, say, a dinner at Chili's. That being said, the Pro-X has far exceeded my expectations in most areas. The battery compartment was much easier to open than most reviewers reported, but that's probably because I read all the way to the last paragraph of K. Sprite's review, where she tells you how to do it. Read and follow her instructions and you'll have no problems. The batteries included with the unit have lasted over 3 months with regular use (7-10 times a week). I have had no trouble with the brush draining/drying, as I set it on the edge of the sink with the brush part slightly off the edge. I don't use the scrub that was included because I prefer Clean & Clear's Daily Pore Scrub, which works incredibly well. I use the Pro-X both in and out of the shower, and it travels so well I'm thinking of getting a second one to keep in my travel bag. The only thing I was disappointed in was the strength/speed of the motor, but to be fair, I was hoping for something more like a sandblaster, where the Pro-X is more like a polisher. This is actually a good thing, because it means I can use it daily without turning my face into hamburger. All in all, I am extremely satisfied with the Pro-X's performance and results. My skin has never been so soft and smooth!

  464. I have to admit I was really surprised by how well this Olay Cleansing System works. After using it for a few months now, my skin has never looked better. The brush is soft enough that it doesn't irritate my skin, but the rotating motion does a much better job of cleaning than just soap and a washcloth. I use the Olay Cleanser or occasionally some other liquid cleansers and am always amazed at how well it removes every trace of makeup and leaves my skin and pores looking spotless. My makeup seems to go on smoother after using it and it also helps keeps away the flakiness of dry winter skin. Even after a few months, I'm still using the original batteries and brushes, so it's pretty low maintenance. I considered the more expensive cleansing brushes, but with how well this Olay has worked for me, I don't see the need to pay triple the price for a different brand.
  465. I have sensitive skin and deep pores that often get clogged. This product is so gentle and leaves my skin exfoliated and cleans my pores! It really shakes up the dirt. After I use the Pro-X, I will use a clinique toner to pull up any excess dirt/oil/makeup. I love this and it is such a great price. Other stores were selling it for over $30. I love it!!

I'm sorry to say I find it quite disappointing. The bristles are so soft and move at a mediocre rate, so I don't really feel much scrubbing/exfolioation being done. I think you can get better exfoliation using a basic washcloth. I also have used a simple 99 cent hand brush from a pharmacy and the Conair facial brush and both of those options feel like they do a better job and cost less. The two advantages I feel the Olay sytem has over the Conair facial brush is that its shape and size do feel more comfortable in the hand and the push button off/on switch is easier to use than the sliding switch on the Conair. However, the Conair switch also offers the option to reverse the direction of the bristles, which also gives it a feeling that it may be doing a bit more thorough cleansing job. I'm going to keep this brush and give the Conair to my teenager who can use a deeper cleaning process at this time. Overall I feel this is one purchase I got \\"sucked into\\" by a company's large marketing budget and the product doesn't live up to the hype.

  492. I'll be honest, I don't have any fancy cleansing gadgets in my bathroom. I've always used the old fashioned exfoliating pads and gloves with my brand of choice for facial cleanser. My big problem area is my nose. If I don't exfoliate every single day, I get blackheads on my nose very quickly. Just rubbing cleanser on the area with my fingers was not enough, so I started using exfoliating gloves with the cleanser and though it's really scratchy and not quite pleasant, it keeps the area clean.<br /><br />Now, is the Pro-X better or worse than \\"manual\\" cleansing? I'd have to honestly say, it's about the same, with one slight edge: the Pro-X is like a daily massage for your face and it does feel quite nice and relaxing as opposed to the scrubbing with the scratchy exfoliating pads. I would say the results are very close with my traditional way of cleansing, and with my clogged pores I can literally see the difference after I've finished. Though the overall process is much more comfortable and enjoyable and the massage factor seems to bring color to my face which is always a plus when you're as pale as I am!<br /><br />I love that it uses plain old AA batteries and has no fancy chargers. Keep it simple! And I love that there's literally no clean up. You wash the little brush after and let it sit to dry. No messy device that gets gunked up. Again, simple! It's comfortable to hold in my hand and the size of the brush is perfect for every area of my face, even around my eyes. I will obviously warn that you close your eyes when using this, as even when you're cleaning your cheeks and chin, the cleanser can and will fling off the brush from time to time and get in your eyes. Aside from that, I can easily get around all the curves and angles of my face, even my nose, with ease. You do have to put a little pressure on it if you are trying to clear blackheads because the gentle brush doesn't do enough without that bit of pressure. Because of that, after only a few weeks of use my poor little brush is all worn in the middle. I hope they make replacements!<br /><br />The only thing I don't like (and this is easily remedied) is their included cleanser. I have very sensitive skin that is prone to over drying and whatever is in that cleanser made my face dry up and flake with only one use. I immediately stopped using it and just put my own cleanser on. Obviously this won't be an issue for everyone, but do yourself a favor and test a small area of your face first. Don't do what I did! ;)<br /><br />Overall a great buy, considering that traditional manual exfoliating gloves/brushes/pads can cost nearly just as much and aren't as comfortable to use.ush is all worn in the middle.   557. First, I want to start out my review by saying WOW, I AM SO IMPRESSED!!! I read numerous reviews before I bought this, and I was really skeptical about it, even with this being the number one selling beauty product on Amazon AND with all of the five star reviews. I didn't actually even come shopping on Amazon for this product, but when I looked at the beauty bestsellers and saw this one had been the #1 seller for so long, I wanted to see what it was and what the hype was about.<br /><br />I am 27, have occasional breakouts, and have semi-oily skin with a few pesky blackheads on my nose. I never wear any makeup other than mascara. I have never felt the need to wear foundation, and when I have tried it in the past, it bugged me having it on my skin, I was always aware of it being there. Because I do occasionally have breakouts and have blackheads, I wanted to go ahead and try this. I ordered it last week on sale from Amazon. It was on sale for around $23 and it had a $5 coupon, so I got it for around $17. Now that I have used it, I can say that I would be willing to pay full price for this.<br /><br />I just received it in the mail today, and immediately used it in the shower. I had no problems getting the batteries in like a lot of people have said in their reviews. I just popped the bottom of, and put the batteries in, popped the bottom back on. When I turned it on I actually wondered if this was going to work well, because the two rotations are so gentle and the bristles on the brush head are so gentle and soft. I was expected a stiffer brush and faster rotation.<br /><br />When I got in the shower, I wet my face, and wet the brush, then I squeezed some of the Olay exfoliating cleaner in stripes across the brush head. Then, I used the brush quickly across my whole face to get the cleaner all over, then went back over each part of my face and took some time to let the brush scrub on each area. I was surprised when the cleaner lathered up a little bit. The scrubbingfelt really good. It felt like the right amount of rotation when combined with the cleaner. After I did every part of my face, I rinsed my face and the brush, and then turned the brush on the low setting and went back over my face one more time and rinsed. After I rinsed my face, I immediately knew this product had done it's job. My face has never felt smoother or cleaner, and I have tried so many different facial cleansers in the past.<br /><br />When I dried off, I looked in the mirror, and my face was GLOWING. My cheeks were rosy, and my skin just looked so healthy. I was SHOCKED. After one use, the difference was just AMAZING!!! Almost all of the blackheads on my nose are gone. As I sit writing this, 2 hours after my shower, my cheeks are still rosy, like I put on blush, and my entire face is still glowing.<br /><br />I didn't use any moisturizer after my shower. Since I have oily skin to begin with, I never use moisturizer. I read a lot of reviews that said this left their skin a little dry, but mine is just perfect. Not too dry, not too oily. And it is SO SOFT!!! My cheeks, forehead, chin and nose are so soft, I can't get over it. It makes me wonder what happened! My skin was not rough or dry before, it has always had a tendency to be soft, but never like this.<br /><br />I will be recommending this product to everyone I know and this product definitely deserves it's high rating and ranking on Amazon. I now know what all the hype was about, and I'm so glad I purchased this!

I find that I'm able to use the product once a day, and my skin doesn't really dry out (although I always apply a moisturizer anyway). It has two speeds, neither of which are too harsh or irritating. I've noticed a dramatic difference in my black heads, blemishes, and pores. It also really helps your skin get the most out of your moisturizer and skin care products. I always feel great after using this and think that everyone is due for a good clean once in awhile, great feeling.
  631. This brush is wonderful! I bought it one month ago (Amazon's price is better than Wal-Mart & Meijer). I have acne prone skin that is naturally oily, but of course dries out with acne product usage. The two speed options are great: the gentle one is perfect for my face every other night (after removing my makeup, I use my own cleanser with the brush) and my face feels as clean and fresh as if I've just had a facial. I like the higher speed for the decolletage area, which feels great, even though the brush is not specifically designed for this. I really can't imagine the $100 or $200 plus brushes being any better than this!

  634. My wife has used this product pretty consistently since we received it over a month ago.
