She feels this is a gadget she would not normally purchase and that she often does not want to take the time to achieve the results it is capable of providing if one wants to spend the time and money. I wish the difference between the two speeds was more pronounced but it's nice to simply squeeze any favorite face wash as often as allowed for your skin type onto this and wash away, sometimes I use it daily and then I leave it alone for a while, easy to use and fun, it makes the skin glow and it's not too strong, you don't want to scrub your face like it's the kitchen floor, so take a light touch and use this sparingly but remember that healthy young skin renews every 28 days so this will helps keep it fresh and smooth. The back of the package has the only instructions that come with the product, which is nuts since even coffee filters these days come with illustrated step by steps. But it does tell you how to wrench off the battery cap and how to prep the face for use. And it's hardly rocket science, so I can't complain.   646. I purchased this in February along with a tube of the Pro-X exfoliating cleanser that goes with this. First off, it doesn't provide nearly enough power for any actual results. It claims it's 6X better than washing alone and I can only assume they mean 6X better than just splashing water on your face because I've gotten much better exfoliation with a washcloth or nylon sponge than this weakling can provide.<br /><br />Secondly, now after 9 weeks of use, one brush head change and 6 batteries later, it no longer works at all. After about 6-7 weeks, it stopped turning on and I had to hold the button down continuously to get it to spin, then in the middle of the night, I'd suddenly start hearing a whirring sound from my bathroom (I thought my drain was haunted), but it was just this little brush suddenly on and spinning by itself. (the switch was the first thing to go...) I was using it in the shower and it claims to be water resistant, but I guess it's resistant for about 3 months since it won't turn on at all anymore. I still have about 1/2 a tube of the cleanser left, so basically that outlasted the actual spin brush! (side note, the cleanser claims to be \\"exfoliating\\" but it has no feeling of crystals or scrubbing properties like other exfoliators I've used.)<br /><br />I guess if you have VERY sensitive skin and are looking for an affordable way to GENTLY massage your face OUTSIDE of the shower, this may be acceptable, but I saw ZERO results either visibly or in how my skin felt. Save your $ and stick with manual washcloths, sponges or scrublets or invest in a Clarisonic.

  651. When it comes to facial brushes, you can spend up to $100 and over, or you can spend under $30-either way, as an esthetician, I can tell you-aside from price, they are really all the same. Sure there are a few things you will get with a more expensive brand, but if you are looking for an inexpensive facial cleansing brush that does a great job-look no further. The Olay Professional Pro-X is just as good-if not better-than the high priced and highly recommended Clarisonic. Now, The Clarisonic will have a few extras, such as more speeds and additional attachments for the body, but if all you need is a high-quality brush for the face, why spend all the extra cash?<br />The Olay Pro-X is a really lightweight, small brush, making it easy to handle. It also makes it easy to take with you when you travel. It has a super-soft brush head, that works very well at either of the two speeds and replacement heads are sold separately and under $10 for 2. It only requires 2 AA batteries, which are included with it. No charger needed. It is water resistant, so it can be used in the shower. It also comes with a sample size of the Olay Pro-X exfoliating Cleanser, which is nice, but I have own my favorite products, and you can use it with any. I just love the way my face feels after using this. You know how your teeth feel after using a electric toothbrush? That really,really clean feeling? Well, that is similar to how my face feels. Very \\"polished\\" Very clean. And unlike with my last facial brush, I don't have to clean the whole countertop after I use it-no messy \\"spraying\\" of cleanser everywhere. Really the only downside I find to this brush is that it would be nice to have a cover or case to keep the brush head protected, but since it is so small, I can use a makeup case. Overall, a great brush for the money.

  672. I bought it for my aunt and she likes it. She didnt know how low the price was. Sorry for the terrible review.
  673. For purely facial (not body) cleansing, I would choose this device over the Clarisonic even if their prices were reversed. It's more gentle, more inherently ergonomic, and the brush head is small enough to easily clean awkward spots like the very back of your jawline or the edges of your nostrils. (As far as the battery installation issue, I found it took me less than 2 seconds after glancing at the instructions printed on the outside of the box.) So... why is gentle better than a literally-sonic scrub action? If you have acne-prone skin you'll know. Too much abrasion irritates the skin and actually incites more blemishes. Ergo, it's always a battle to figure out how to really clean off makeup (and oil, dirt, etc.) without creating more problems. For me, the Clarisonic, even on the gentlest setting with the sensitive brush head, made things worse not better. (But that's me -- people with different skin issues may have very different experiences.) I didn't start out expecting much from the Olay device. Another reviewer mentioned that the Olay device doesn't do \\"sonic\\" (jittery) cleansing, but only spins (btw, be sure to pin your hair back or it can get caught in the spin!). That was partly why my expectations were low, but I discovered I didn't feel much qualitative difference -- I only know that the Olay causes a lot less injury to my face while still getting the makeup really off, either it's because it's not \\"sonic\\" or uses a softer brush head, or both. I tested it with a long-wear foundation (which, by design, is particularly hard to remove), and started out by wiping my face with both sides of a wet \\"facial\\" towelette. While plenty of makeup came off on that, I knew there was plenty more. I wet my face and applied my own creamy (non-exfoliating) cleanser, then turned on the Olay device. It was super-lightweight, very easy to hold and maneuver, and because of its smaller size and gentler action allowed me to use it in places I'd never successfully cleaned with the Clarisonic. Every 20 seconds or so I'd rinse the Olay, with more makeup visibly coming off each time. After that was done I immediately applied my acne-fighting moisturizer, which seemed to absorb much better than when I was just cleansing without a device. After a few days I saw a visible difference in clarity -- without changing or adding *any* skincare products other than using the Olay device. So: it cleans well enough to wash away pore-gunk that I was failing at removing before, while seeming to create a much more welcoming environment for my anti-acne moisturizer. I'm an adult (mid-30s) with very acne-prone skin, so my experience might not be relevant for people with different skin issues who want or need a more aggressive scrubbing action. For me, the Olay is perfect, does exactly what I need it to do without causing new problems by doing more.
  674. awesome product, it works great..
  675. I have been using this for about 3 months now and am amazed at how good it works! Very gentle, but effective. It makes your skin look and feel great! An incredible value at this price. Definitely recommend this product!

This brush cleansing tool softened the texture of my face after the first use. My pores are cleaner and smaller. My middle age acne is clearing up. Use any type of facial cleanser/soap you want with it. If you want more foam on your face just wet the brush head a little more. For an extra treat once a week I use about 3 drops of Dr. Bronner's Castile Peppermint Liquid Soap on the brush head and clean my face with it. The peppermint soap has a cooling effect on your face while you massage it with the brush head. I do strongly suggest that after washing and drying your face that you always use a moisturizer, even if it just a tiny amount. I like to use a few drops of Complex 15 Therapeutic Moisturizing face cream.

  690. I really like this. I compared, investigated and debated between this machine and the Clarisonic Plus for several days. I liked the CP because it came with a body brush, but then it occurred to me that I could just have an extra brush with the Pro-X that would serve basically the same purpose, so out went that argument for the CP. Heck, at this price, I could just buy an addition unit to use as a body brush! I went back and forth between the two, reading reviews and so on, and it was when I finally saw a report by a dermatologist who said that the Clarisonic works great in cleaning the skin but that it's not an exfoliator and doesn't stop wrinkles. So, I figured that if what the Clarisonic boils down to is a facial cleansing brush, well, why not just go with the Olay for a whole lot less. So, I did. And it's great! I generally use a make-up wipe before using the Olay Pro-X brush; however, I did a little test early on and used the brush (on a fully made-up face) BEFORE using the make-up wipe. Believe it or not, when I wiped my face after using the brush, there was NOTHING on the wipe. It did that good a job of cleaning my face! So, I'm happy. And very happy I didn't fork over $200. And my skin looks beauuutiful!

  694. Great price, almost 15.00 less than major chain store. Works great, I also use it with my other facial routine and it works terrific.
  695. The results of this product are incredible. Prior to use, I had blackheads on my nose and chin that wouldn't go away no matter what I tried in addition to occasional pimples and some dry, flaky patches of skin. Acne products over dry my skin and are only minimally effective on my blackheads and pimples. Moisturizing products help my dry patches but make my pores look huge and, of course, increase my acne.<br /><br />Since using this product, my blackheads are almost entirely gone. My skin looks noticeably better with each use. My pores are much smaller. The dry patches of skin are gone. I have had no new pimples. My skin looks better than it ever has in my adult life and I've only been using this thing for about a week and a half. It is absolutely incredible.<br /><br />The cleaning tool is a very soft brush that spins on two settings, either high or low. It runs on batteries that are included. The casing is made in a way that allows it to withstand water for shower use.<br /><br />The cleanser it comes with has very fine exfoliating granules. I have been using a very small amount each time. I only use this once a day because I don't want to over exfoliate my skin. I believe that the magic is really more the brush and less the cleanser. I am looking for something more natural with the same fine exfoliating texture. The cleanser that comes with this set is also a little more expensive than Olay products typically are - currently $15 for 6 ounces -- if you decide to keep using it.<br /><br />Olay recommends you replace the brush heads every 3 months and they are currently $8.50 for a set of 2. They swap out easily so if you have more than one person in the household that will be using this, you could change the head between uses.<br /><br />Overall, this product has, by far, exceeded my expectations. I am extremely happy with the purchase.
  696. This was a gift. The person who received it said she loved it
  697. I love this product! It gets my face really clean and leaves my skin super soft! I've seen results within just a few weeks and will continue to use this and recommend it to my family and friends!
  698. I am in my 20's and have dry, fair, sensitive skin with a minor case of rosacea. I am also a make-up artist and need my skin to look flawless. Having dry flaky skin is difficult enough, but add sensitive in the mix and it is a real pain to find a product that will exfoliate without causing irritation. For the price, it seemed worth to at least try the pro-x.<br /><br />I love it! It makes my skin feel smooth and hydrated without causing much irritation. Other than that, I LOVE this product.<br /><br />Thanks!
  699. I've had this brush for a few months now and I've noticed that ever since I started using it I have way more acne on my forehead. I had a really cheap Pretika brush that I bought at Rite Aid for only about $12 a few years ago, and even that one was better than this Olay brush. The head is also much smaller than any other brand I've used, so it takes a much longer period of time just to wash my face, which is really annoying when I'm in a hurry. The Pretika brush washed my face faster, and much more thoroughly than this brush does. The head also rotates much more slowly than any other brush I've used, even on its faster setting and with new batteries. Don't bother with this one. It looks pretty, but it won't make YOU look any prettier.

  712. It feels amazing and has a massage like effect.<br />I use a regular anti-acne cleanser that I have so you have a lot of freedom with what products you want to use to cleanse your face.<br />I have had this for two months and have been using the same batteries since I purchased it so it's very good in that aspect. However, it takes forever to actually open it to install the batteries, and that's the only complaint I have about it.<br />You can have it in the shower and not have to worry about getting water damage.<br />OVERALL, It's well worth the money, can't believe it's so cheap for a product that is so efficient and does what it says.<br />My skin looks more even, is cleaner, and is so much softer.   720. This brush works amazingly well! I have used the real Clarisonic brush that costs nearly 10x as much as this one, as well as the Clarisonic knock-off called Pretika, and I can honestly say that the Olay brush is my favorite of the bunch! It's bristles are the perfect texture and the motor's speed is just right. I even prefer the way it fits in my hand (it's much smaller than the other two). Last year I was trying to decide between purchasing the Pretika and the Olay brush, and I ended up with the Pretika. A little over a year later, it stopped working and it was outside of warranty, so I decided to try the other one. I wish I had chosen the Olay brush in the first place! The Pretika brush is MUCH rougher on your face. I can't believe I used it for a year! The Olay's brush head is so much softer, but still really effective. I have only been using it for about 4 days and my skin already feels different.
  721. I purchased this product back in Februaury. I immediately saw an improvement in my skin's tone, texture, and clarity. The love affair was short-lived however. In 3 months time the motor started dying out. I replaced the batteries, but it did nothing to change the now super slow speed. I wrote to P&G and immediately was contacted. A 'replacement' coupon was sent to me. No stores would accept this coupon. I wrote back, I was sent an e-mail advising me to inform the retailers that they would receive their money back, as it was an official company coupon. I still could not use it. I was told a check for $29.99 would be mailed to me. After 2 months and no check I sent another e-mail. I have now been informed that it is company policy not to issue replacements, either of the product, or in coupon form. I also was told that I would receive a check for $29.00 now, not $29.99. Even though I received a prompt respose initially, I'm dissatisfied. I received conflicting information from the same person. I have all original correspondence(e-mails, letter, and coupon.) In the meantime I still haven't purchased a new brush and I'm waiting on the check.

  723. I bought this item and liked the weight of the unit and the strength of the motor. What I did not like was that the brush head was so extremely soft that I found it wasnt doing much exfoliation, even after a week of every day use. I am a regular exfoliator (both chemically with retin A and Alpha hydroxy acids; and mechanically with a scrubber). I guess if you have super sensitive skin, this might work for you, but most people just have average skin. The whole point of exfoliating is to irritate the skin to turn over new cells and produce collagen. This machine is barely doing a thing, except producing a nice foam. They really should PROVIDE TWO BRUSHES, one for sensitive skin and one for more friction. I called the company and got my $30 back. I'll stick with the $18 unit that isnt quite as nice, but has a little firmer brush head to do what its supposed to do.

I did find that using it was a bit much for my skin - any kind of exfoliation, mechanical (like this) or chemical (retinoids, etc.)tend to get my skin kind of overexcited if used too often, so that it gets rough from trying (apparently) to overcome the loss of cells or protective layers. So I didn't use it for a while, and then when I picked it up again, it appeared to have two colors of mold on the brush section, at the base of the bristles! I am fairly sure that our water supply here contains algae, yeasts, and goodness knows what else, so that isn't amazing or anything. However, it's unpleasant and a bit scary! I'm trying to decide whether to bother getting a replacement brush.

  741. I have acne prone combination skin and I came across this as a top seller under beauty items on Amazon. Out of sheer desperation (I've tried a lot of skincare products), I ordered it. I've only used it for a week, but I can say my skin looks noticeably better. It's smoother (your face really feels amazingly smooth after using it), brighter, and makeup goes on looking so much nicer. Not to mention the best part: I've broken out less. I don't remember the last time I went a day without breaking out, so this is saying something. I also feel like my acne creams and moisturizers soak in so much better, like other reviews have mentioned. Oh, and by the way, the battery case isn't as difficult to open as some reviews have made it sound. I'm a weak girl with tiny hands and if I can open this, I'm pretty sure anyone else can-- just get a good grip. It's made to be waterproof so it needs to be tight, so just put some strength into it :) If I remember, I will write an update after a few more weeks of use. But so far, so good! Update: 11/20/11 Hi, so as promised here's an update on this product after another 2 weeks of use. So far, I'm still loving this facial brush. It's still keeping my skin much clearer than in the past and my skin has developed a healthier looking glow to it. Be warned, though, your pores won't shrink after only 2 weeks of use (for the reviews that have mentioned this, I still haven't seen a drastic difference but that's maybe because my pores are really big and it would take a lot more deep cleaning for them to appear smaller). Definitely keep expecting super soft skin and great moisturizer absorption. For people with skin that tends to be on the dry side (like me!), I recommend using the brush only at night, before applying a heavy moisturizer. Also, for those of you on the edge about this brush because of some reviews bashing the brush quality, please believe me when I say you seriously don't want anything more abrasive than this. Your skin will hateyou for scrubbing it like a metal pot, rather than gently exfoliating it with a soft bristle brush. The point is not to have amazing skin after one scrub, but to routinely use the brush so as to see improvement over time :) Update: 12/15/11 I'm happy to say that my clearer skin has remained consistent since using the pro-x. Sad thing is, I looked today and Amazon is now selling it for under $20 when I bought mine for $25 :( Oh, I also saw Costco selling the same system but with a huge bottle of that cleanser for a decent price. I would not recommend getting the Costco pack unless you KNOW you like the cleanser, though. For me, the cleanser is nothing special-- it smells quite bad, though (very, very plastic-y smell).
  742. I looked at all the $200 facial brushes, and they were all too large for me to hold comfortably though I have a normal size 7 hand. Then on impulse I bought this brush, it was so cheap! It is perfect to hold, the brush comes off for washing, it has two speeds and the lower one does a nice overall job, the upper good for difficult places. Now the wonderful part. It works. I've always done home facials, but they are messy. This brush is small enough for the medicine cabinet, and it takes about 1 minute to use! I use a tiny bit liquid hand soap with water to wet my face, then go over with the brush. Then rinse and apply moisturizer. Every face is different but I find that a few times a week keeps my face blackhead free. It even got rid of some tiny skin tabs and lowered bumps that had been there for years. After a year the brush is still fine and the batteries still working. I can't recommend this little brush enough.

  753. I bought this after reading the many reviews raving about it and the few that were not as pleased with it. I used the clarisonic a couple of times and I debated whether to buy my own or buy this Olay. I decided mainly because of the cost to go with Olay. I am so happy I did! I have to say I love how small it is, it fits nicely in your hand and travels well. I also prefer that the Olay pro-x head turns in circles as opposed to the clarisonic that just pulsates back and forth. It has two speeds or you can choose to not turn it on and just manually move it in slow circles on your skin, I do that some days and it works just as well. I love using this every morning. My face always feels so clean and refreshed, and the bristles on the head are nice and soft. I will say the only complaint I have is with the facial wash that comes with it. I did not like it at all, well more it did not agree with my face. It made me break out badly so I stopped using it and I have used the Olay pro-x with Purity, Philosophy's face wash, which worked much better, but didn't necessarily help with my acne, but the pro-x still worked great! And now I use it with Obagi Clenziderm, which works well with it too and definitely helped clear up the acne. I am aware that the box does not come with instructions for how often to use it or how to open the thing to replace batteries, but that's not a big deal. Start using it every other day depending how sensitive your skin is and add or lessen the days you use it. To replace the batteries you just pull the bottom part out. It is a bit stubborn, but it's easy to get the hang of it. After using it every morning my batteries lasted for 3 months. Overall, GREAT product and I wouldn't trade it in for the world! Easy to use, travels great, cheap price!
  754. I bought his as a gift. I had bought one for myself previously and really liked it. I have not used the much more expensive versions of this device but cannot imagaine how they could work any better! Great for the price.
  755. I enjoy my pro-x system. I especially love that it is waterproof and that I can just leave it in the shower and use it there. The box comes with the cleaning system, one brush, batteries and a mini cleansing solution. I recommend keeping the little tube of cleansing solution for travel, and then going to the store to purchase the bigger container of solution for home use. I've had this product for a few months and have not had to change the batteries yet; I use it about every other day. When you use the product the first few times when the bristles are still new, you do feel a difference in the slow and high speeds; but now that I've worn the bristles out I am unable to tell the difference with the two speeds of the brush.

  765. Having lifelong problems with blackheads, whiteheads and nasty \\"bumps\\" on my face, I was looking for an effective way to remove makeup and exfoliate. Combined with the cleanser/scrub, my face feels really clean and I haven't had the problems with the outbreaks. The brush is soft and gentle, easy to detach and wash, and scrubber has 2 speeds.   873. For years, I've been looking for a solution to the scaling that happens on my cheeks during the winter months. Wash clothes are too rough and cause even more damage and irritation. Exfoliating cleaners seem to just dry my skin even more. The Olay Pro X cleaning device offers a soft-bristle brush that rotates at two speeds offering gentle cleansing and exfoliation. After a month, my face is softer and my skin is clear. Though the system comes with a sample cleanser, I'm using my usual cleanser but you can even use a beauty bar, if you wish. I'm using the device to clean my face, neck and upper chest.   874. So although I was forewarned from previous reviews, I too found the battery compartment VERRRRY difficult to open. I called the # on the box and told them my problem and that I was going to return the product and post a negative review. The customer service rep was sympathetic. First of all although I appreciated the instructions in other reviews it wasn't clear to me that the part that comes off is the little end piece that says \\"OLAY Professional\\" on it...........use a ruberized bottle opener to improve your grip and rock that small end piece back and forth (like taking a cork out of a wine bottle).........the end piece is very slippery and at first this didn't work. I just kept trying and all of sudden it worked......I just tried it again and couldn't do it at first!!!! however, what I learned is that if you twist in one direction it all of sudden pops (you are actually releasing a seal which is what keeps it waterproof) and then it comes off easily. I told the customer rep that at the very least they should have a label on the box pointing to where the battery compartment is so that you know what you're trying to get off!!! I'll review the actual product later...........now that I can use it!

There's enough difference that for the fast setting I have to move the product around faster so that I dont peel my skin off. Believe you me, it does scrub your skin. I like to use it with my favorite facial cleaner. Some may say their skin feels radiant, but I think its because your top-layer of skin was just scrapped off so beware not to overdo it. The product is waterproof, so it can be used over the sink or in the shower or even in the bathtub for something more intimate (~_^). Battery seems to last awhile, but if you are worried that the compartment is hard to take off, just put on some dishwasher gloves or latex gloves on and it opens easily.

  989. Proper exfoliating is super important in preventing breakouts, says my knowledgeable and experienced esthetician. Of course, it all makes sense now. That dead skin is the stuff preventing the oil from getting through. The missing link!<br /><br />After getting the outer shell of dead skin professionally removed from my face, this product (or the more expensive Clairsonic) was recommended to me. I will not be getting the Clairsonic because I am so happy with the results from this (and my skin was ultra-funky). It's at least a good first step and if you don't like it, give it to your little sister and your only out 20 bucks.<br /><br />Product comes with one soft-bristle brush, strong enough to remove that built up skin, soft enough to leave you with skin-intact and minimal redness unless you are the aggressive type. If your skin is super-sensitive, this might overdo it, so go easy and maybe use a different exfoliating product or just a gentle cleanser. Good thing there's two speeds! Not heavy, fits in hand well without slipping out, waterproof/submersible, comes with two real (Duracell) batteries too, been using it almost every day for a month and no signs of power degeneration.<br /><br />Also great for the legs, right before shaving and underarms to prevent in-growns.<br /><br />This also brings healthy circulation to your skin, hastening the healing response....not something you can easily do when washing with your hands.<br /><br />My personal results....One month later after using almost 1-2 times a day (gently) with my own cleanser and taking a day off if getting too much drying:<br /><br />Skin, surface now smooth and one layer opposed to many layers of various flakiness. Reduction of blackheads on nose. Pores almost empty. Immediate positive results after two days (smoother skin), but took 2-3 weeks for the residual acne to clear up. Feels like my face can breathe! Week 4, huge reduction of breakouts, I'd say 75% more clear. Super happy!<br /><br />Make sure you are using professional skin products, not that cheap stuff at the box stores. The ingredients and preservatives in the cheap products can irritate skin more or get trapped in your pores. You may have to invest a couple hundred but you will make it back in return when your self-confidence is through the roof and the fancy-dinner dates start rolling in. Buy a good cleanser, toner, a mask to control the oil in the warm seasons, this beautiful product, and a good moisturizer for afterwards because the brushing does cause drying. I hear good things about the Eminence line, also acnewhisperer.com is a great place for info and samples. If your skin is breaking out more after using this, you may be using the wrong cleanser or using this product too much. If you over strip your skin of its oil, it will produce more oil...not good.<br /><br />Happy skin brushing!you are using professional skin products, not that cheap stuff at the box stores. The ingredients and preservatives in the cheap products can irritate skin more or get trapped in your pores. You may have to invest a couple hundred but you will make it back in return when your self-confidence is through the roof and the fancy-dinner dates start rolling in. If you over strip your skin of its oil, it will produce more oil...not good.<br /><br />Happy skin brushing!

  1125. If you get white heads, black heads, or have trouble with dirty/clogged pores this product can really help.<br /><br />This is not a \\"sonic\\" cleaner like other offerings at much higher prices and should not be compared to those. This unit uses an electric motor to spin a soft brush wheel in one direction. When used properly, it provides a gentle cleaning.<br /><br />I did not like the cleaning solution that came with this product, I threw it away and made my own. I don't think it's a good idea to use an exfoliate with abrasive particles with this unit, it may damage your skin.<br /><br />I found a 50/50 mix of [[ASIN:B001DJDP7C Thayer Unscented Witch Hazel, 12 Fluid Ounce]] and [[ASIN:B00015XAQ0 Avalon Organics Refreshing Cleansing Gel Vitamin C, 8.5 Fluid Ounce]] to be an excellent cleaning solution to use with this product. Shake it up before using and it will produce a nice lather.<br /><br />This product is water resistant so it can be used in the shower. The battery compartment is sealed with a silicone strip.<br /><br />The all white design looks great. The soft rubberized exterior feels durable and is comfortable to hold.<br /><br />For the price I don't think this product can be beat, although there are better options at higher price points.<br /><br />The major problem with this product is that the motor only spins in one direction. A pulsing back and forth would probably be more effective, and the sonic products that cost a lot more are definitely more effective.<br /><br />Pros:<br />----------------------<br />+ Great value<br />+ Solid construction, durable finish<br />+ Comfortable to grip in one hand<br />+ Effective at cleaning surface level dirty/clogged pores<br />+ Rubberized exterior and silicone seals make are water resistant<br />+ Long battery life, uses 2 standard AA batteries<br /><br />Cons / Considerations:<br />----------------------<br />- Brush spins in only one direction<br />- Not a \\"sonic\\" system like higher priced products such as ClariSonic<br />- Using this product too often or pressing too hard with it will probably damage your skin<br /><br />Final Thoughts:<br />--------------<br />Used in moderation and with the right cleansing solution this is a great tool. The formula I am using works great for me and seems to be improving my skin. I use it about 2-3 times per week and I'm careful to be gentle with the pressure.<br /><br />Do not go crazy with this thing and use it every day or press really hard on your skin with the brush. Use it carefully and you can expect to get very good results.<br /><br />If your budget can afford a \\"sonic\\" tool, you may want to consider going for that instead because you can get much \\"deeper\\" cleaning.lariSonic<br />- Using this product too often or pressing too hard with it will probably damage your skin<br /><br />Final Thoughts:<br />--------------<br />Used in moderation and with the right cleansing solution this is a great tool.   1166. Well after reading tons of reviews for this brush and the Clarisonic one I decided to get the Olay one, Amazon had it for $21.97 and then had a $5 off coupon, so I went for it. Love it! I was amazed and knew it was because of the Olay brush, because I've not changed anything else. I will say I am usually oily T zone type and I don't know if it's the change in season's here in IA or if it's the Olay brush, but I'm not NEAR as oily, in fact I'm dry in some areas. So I will be getting some moisturizer for my face, for the first time. Another thing, I can see that my pores are cleaner looking. I would say that some of my pores that were big, to me, are smaller now. I love this little brush. It was super cheap compared to the other one everyone raves about, I'm not about to spend $100 on a face brush when this one is working quite well for me. It did catch my hair a time or two because the head spins around, but have learned to keep my long curly hair back. I only used the cleanser that came w/ it once, it was fine. I have slightly sensitive skin, comes w/ age I guess and the sample cleanser worked fine. The rest of the time I use Bare Minerals cleansers and make up - love that stuff! You could use it w/ any cleanser. I would say that my makeup goes on nicer though since I've been using the Olay brush. For the price I think it's totally worth it. And I think it takes lots of time for your skin to adjust to getting itself all cleaned out better than it has ever been, so I would suggest to wait a while before you make any judgements on the ability of the brush.   1223. Love this thing. I didn't want to spend a lot of money for one of these machines, so this was a great way to introduce myself to a whole new world. By day 3-5, that's when the real magic happens. You'll notice that your make up goes on much smoother, that you don't have to dab the excess oil off your face in the middle of the day, and your skin will feel so much lighter. It literally takes a full week for the machine to work through the layers and layers of dead skin, dirt, and grime that you never knew you had. My combination skin is now very tame, doesn't grease up in the middle of the day, pores look smaller, skin looks clearer, and my skin feels so much lighter. The only warning I give is to only use it once a day. It's so much fun to use that you'll be tempted to use it every time you wash your face (assuming you wash your face in the morning and night). Stick to doing it once a day so you don't overdry your skin and start peeling. End of the day works great for me because it gets rid of the grime from the day and lets my night cream seep in more, but that's a personal preference. Highly recommend this product. Works great at a great price.

  1244. I realize that this is NOT a Clarisonic. If you are looking for the Olay system to be a cheaper alternative to the Clarisonic, you will be disappointed. This device is small, great for facial scrubbing. It comes with a small tube of exfoliating scrub as well. This is nice for those looking to shed some dry skin (gross, I know) and polish up their face. I have a tendency to have dry skin come spring/summer, so this was my saving grace this year. After the first use, I noticed a significant decrease in dry skin and have noticed some of my dryness-caused redness disappearing. It was amazing. I have owned/been using this guy for 3 weeks now and have noticed that my oily/sensitive skin has become smoother, less irritated, and less oily (fun bonus I wasn't even looking for)! Also, I stopped using the provided scrub because I personally think a heavier duty scrub works better. I bought SoftSoap Glow Scrub, which has apricot seeds as the scrubber, and use it with this system. I'm much happier with the results with that versus with the provided scrub. The Clarisonic is a bit bulkier and more heavy duty. It you feel you need something like that, definitely forgo purchasing this.

  1397. I finally decided to buy a cleansing brush after reading lots of reviews online and hearing about them from friends. I didn't want to spend $200+ on my first brush, since I wasn't sure how it would work for me so I spent a long time looking for an affordable option with largely positive reviews. The brush spins, it doesn't vibrate like other brushes. There are two speeds, high and low, but I typically use the high speed setting. It's waterproof so I'm able to use it in the shower. After two weeks of use, my skin is looking and feeling fantastic. I'd give it five stars, but for the first week of use, it seemed like it was making my skin worse! I started getting lots of whiteheads and had a few red acne bumps, but I kept using it and the zits went away and my skin is much clearer now. I think it was bringing up some of the nasty old dirt my face was harboring, despite me washing my face twice daily. So I took off one star, only because my skin looked crazy for the first week of use. I recommend using it every other day and you should be fine.

  1399. So I've already gone through my third one in about a year and a half. I like that there are settings for different speeds. I try not getting it wet when washing my face in the sink, and always dry it off if even a tiny drop of water lands on it (by inside, I'm referring to where the battery goes.. It's literally brown/black-corroded). With my CVS brand brush, I actually can use it in the shower and it hasn't even shown 1 sign of corrosion. I still clean it out just to make sure.

Same idea, if it doesn't vibrate, I don't think it cleans my skin and pores as well.<br />* not rechargeable and no base.   1430. I was giving a spa treatment as a gift, and I had a professional use a \\"top of the line\\" cleanser on my face. My face was so clear, bright and soft after, I wanted to be able to do this at home. I looked at models similar to what the spa used, but $200? No way I can afford that. Then I found this system, and for something under $25, this does a job almost equal to the treatment in the spa. As I get a little more proficient at working it, I think my results will be better, just as good as my spa treatment (although the spa has wonderful tea, and the bathrobes are to die for!) For the price, you can't beat it. You won't find anything better at a better price, and yes, you will get results like you would get at a fancy spa.<br /><br />UPDATE: A friend of mine invested in the Clarisonic. She swears by it, but she hasn't used the Olay product. I tried the Clarisonic, and I can say that you will get results that are as good with the Olay as you will with Clarisonic. I didn't find any difference in results on my skin, but there is a BIG difference in price. I also travel a bit, so I prefer the battery operated Olay product because it's easier to pack and use on the go (a little tricky when you first change the batteries, but after that, you're good to go). The Clarisonic is a little heavier, so you can get a little rough on the skin. The Olay is lighter, so you can control the force on your face better. And you still get good results, so again, for the price, the Olay wins.<br /><br />One note - don't \\"grind\\" it into your face. It doesn't make it work better, just go easily over your face and you will have the best results. It's meant to exfoliate the top layer(s) of your skin, so pressing down on it as you go over your face will not do any more for your skin. I tried difference pressures, and less is more. It's better to use a light touch and go over your face a couple of times than to push the brush into your face.<br /><br />This also works very wellon your body too. I use it on my legs, and I get a really smooth result. It also helps with shaving or waxing, because the fine hairs that don't always grow completely out get released from the skin so your waxing or shaving is more effective. Very nice.<br /><br />ANOTHER UPDATE: Best results with this product comes when you use a great cream. Can't stress this enough. When you exfoliate the old skin, you need to take care of the new skin coming up. I use the Olay cleanser because it is a really good exfoliator and works well with the pro x, but I don't use their cream. I get the best results with a different cream -[[ASIN:B00BD822BI Bel Essence Anti Aging Treatment - Intensive All Natural Anti-Wrinkle, Facial Lift Skin Care Formula - 1.5oz]]. I love this because it's all natural and it has a better result than the creams I was buying at Sephora at 100+ a jar. Just goes to show that the more expensive product isn't necessarily the best. The effect of this cream on my skin is incredible. My skin is softer, smoother, and the fine lines around my eyes and lips are gone, and my skin is always hydrated. I have dark spots on my face, and they have faded to the point where minimal make up covers them up completely. The same for the deeper lines on my forehead and between my brows - they are shorter, not as deep and barely noticeable with a little foundation. I also have dry spots on my face and some oily spots - this cream has evened it all out. No more small red patches where the dry skin is, and even though the cream has oils in it, my break outs are less. This pro really cleans my skin and exfoliates it really well too. Then when I add the cream, my face just glows. I feel like I have taken 10 years of living off my face after using it, and then with the Bel Essence, my skin is even softer, line free, even toned and firmer.
  1431. I love this cleansing thingy (what do you even call this thing?). It works so well. I started out using it twice a day but that was too much for my skin to handle so now I just use it once. I use it in the shower every single day and this product has proved itself to be as waterproof as the makers claim. Also, I've had this for 2ish months and haven't had to replace the brush head or batteries yet. Also the face cleanser that they sent with the cleansing thingy is really nice. It has very fine particles so it exfoliates but isn't too harsh. I use Neutrogena oil free acne wash daily with the brush and once or twice a week, I'll use the face cleanser that came with the brush. I would recommend rinsing thoroughly after every use, don't use it for too many minutes because it'll make your face raw, and don't use it more times daily than your skin can handle because that will also make your skin raw and when it gets raw it produces more oil which causes more acne. I would buy this a million times over because I'm so pleased with the results.

Somehow it is way easier to brush longer when it feels good and soothing, is effortless, maybe even a little fun, and you see results.<br /><br />Sadly, in my experience, almost all the products I love and rely on get discontinued, or reappear as some new, improved version - at twice the price and half the capability.   1492. Edit( October 18, 2015) Thought I'd give an accurate review now that I've had it for a few months. My face is now 95% clear! I've been BB cream and makeup free for a week now since it finally cleared. it's not perfect but let's face it no one has perfect clear skin. this has just cleared my red spots from picking, scabs, and overall redness, it's evened out my skin tone as well, that it looks as if I'm wearing makeup. I haven't seen my skin this clear since I was a kid. I can go makeup free!! I've cut down my getting ready for work by 12 minted from being nit picky, making sure makeup is evenly spread etc. I've been using it once a day for 2 months! it doesn't stop acne it's just made it manageable. my routine: morning: Wash hands in warm water mild soap, clean under nails (even short ones) rigorously with nail clipper file thing lol. wash hands one more time to get nail gunk I missed off. Apply my routine face lotion. Night: After I'm doing most of my eating and stuff for the day( only reason is food particles get caught on your face even if you wipe and clean anything just from eating neatly etc, also because of dry skin, sweat, dead skin, pollutants in the air we can't see. that gets caught in them. 1) wash hands, Turn water on HOT. Apply the exfoliant it comes with or your own. turn on high setting(your preferred speed). Spend five minutes clearing everything, Rinse brush with hot water every 1-2 minutes till complete. 2- Rinse brush thoroughly directly with hot water while on, takes 30 seconds. 3- Dab brush dry, wipe and put away brush. Turn water on warm. Rinse face with warm water. 4- Pat face dry (preferably on fairly clean towel) 5- Clean under fingernails again , wash hands. wipe dry. 6- Apply moisturizer same from morning. Original review (August 2015) I haven't been using this product all that long but I wanted share my rave review all because I got results so fast it was like day and night. I almost feel like those proactive people on TV lol! anyways, I had great skin as a kid. then of course the teens years settle in, insecurity, stress and sensitive skin became my nightmare. If your like me and began to wear makeup to cover up breakouts only for the makeup to cause those breakouts this product may be for you. my skin got worse and worse, luckily I'm in my 20s now and hormones have settled and my sensitive skin went away. however I'm left with acne impossible to get rid of. I've tried everything, blackhead removers, eating better, acne cleansing systems, sacyclic acid nothing helped. didn't change anything but I felt my face turned into a in-penetrable war zone. nothing got in or out. I wasn't willing to give up my love of the occasional junk food and soft drinks in favour of veggies and water to keep my skin clear. I've done it , life sucks always worrying about food destroying my skin. I just clean it better now. food isn't the issue. I was looking to get rid of my acne enough so wouldn't need to wear a foundation anymore to cover my blemishes. so foundation would not cause breakouts and I could break free from the catch -22 . This product changed that. it was my last hope. my days of wishing I could rip off my face and scrub the inside are gone. gory sounding I know. I used it same day I got the product. I bought it at my local drug store on sale though. I used my apricot scrub but I actually like the softer exfoliant it comes with. it's optional. anyways I use it for 15-20 min a session everyday a bit excessive but I've got bad skin I figure I'll spend less time once my skin gets better. I can see it pushing blackheads out I've got the ridiculously deep ones, and it removing dead skin cells. and my skin is softer, clearer, and absorbs moisturizing lotion better. it would never do that before. it's my miracle worker. and it's only been a week. products don't have that day and night difference for me ever. I now use a light BBcream to cover up the minor blemishes left. my routine; 1.remove makeup with makeup removing cleanser dry face 2. add exfoliant to the brush dampen brush with warm water run along face on high setting 3. pat face dry with clean cloth

  1500. I have only been using this for a week, and I can already see positive changes in my skin that make this cleansing system worth every penny.<br /><br />Before I get into my review- I want to explain that even as a teenager, I have never had major acne, and I only rarely get one or two pimples as an adult, but I have a lot of blackheads on my nose and chin. I bought the expensive nose blackhead strips and even did at-home DIY remedies, and yet I still continued to have SO many blackheads. Usually, when I break out, it is one of these blackheads on my chin that has manifested itself.<br /><br />In the first few days of using this, some of the blackheads formed into pimples, because the dirt was being lifted out of the pore, basically. A few of the blackheads on my cheeks became bumps too, but they went away within a couple days, because I did not pop them and just continued to use the brush. If you have more acne, you will probably go through a longer process of new breakouts caused by this brush, but in a lot of cases, it is a necessary step to getting better skin.<br /><br />I have always been very strict with my skin care routine. I always remove my makeup, wash, and moisturize my face at night with a wash cloth. I have also bought a lot of different cleansers- both high-end brands and drug store, trying to find the best fit for my skin.<br />On Day One, i used this brush to take my makeup off, and when I woke up the next morning, I was shocked to see that my face was still as soft and clean as it had been the night before. Normally, no matter how well I cleaned my face with a wash cloth, and no matter how expensive the cleanser, I always wake up with an oily face, so seeing myself in the mirror without any grease at all in the morning feels life-changing.<br /><br />My skin looks more radiant, and my makeup goes on smoother. If I use it again in the morning, I can go throughout the day without worrying if I need to get an oil blotting sheet, or check in the mirror to see if my makeup has slid off my face. It is such a deep clean that I can now go throughout my day feeling more confident in my appearance.<br />The blackheads on my nose are noticeably less dark in only one week. They look like the dirt is being scrubbed out of them, and I can only hope that the pores will get smaller if I continue to use this brush, since one week is not really long enough to show major results.<br /><br />This brush only has two settings- low and high. The low setting is basically worthless. There is something about the high speed that helps create suds to carry the cleaning product around your entire face. It also works better in the shower. Just take it out of the shower when you are done. Don't leave it in there, because other people gave negative reviews saying how water got into the battery compartment. I just leave mine in a cup standing up on my vanity next to the rest of my products.<br /><br />The Olay product that you get with the brush kit is very, very small. It is convenient for traveling, but the full-size bottle is almost as expensive as the brush kit itself! I have tried dozens of products over the years, and several with this brush. The drug store cleansers I recommend using with this brush are Simple Moisturizing Cleanser and L'Oreal 360. For more high-end cleansers, I recommend Clinique face soap and Philosophy Purity Made Simple, because these cleansers alone, even with a wash cloth, did wonders for my skin, and would be even better combined with this brush.<br /><br />Also remember to get a good moisturizer! After exfoliating, lotions with perfume may also sting, cause redness, and possible breakouts. So I recommend anything fragrance free and natural. Target Up&Up brand makes a really good Oatmeal extract lotion that is an Aveeno dupe. Burts Bees also makes great natural lotions that work well on sensitive, raw skin.<br /><br />Since I do not have major skin problems, I could see my results right away, but not everyonemight. If you have a lot of problems going on with your skin that need some TLC, it may take longer. Also, if you know for a face that your skin is extremely sensitive to exfoliating, this may not be for you. You may want to start off with something more mild, like the L'Oreal 360 scrubbing tool before graduating to this type of cleaning system.might. If you have a lot of problems going on with your skin that need some TLC, it may take longer. Also, if you know for a face that your skin is extremely sensitive to exfoliating, this may not be for you. You may want to start off with something more mild, like the L'Oreal 360 scrubbing tool before graduating to this type of cleaning system.

  1563. This is the holy grail facial cleansing tool. I've been using this for about 3 months and I cannot stray from using this now. I have huge pores, oily skin, and frequent breakouts. My makeup goes on A LOT better and it wears longer because I'm not sweating it off with my huge pores. It does take batteries instead of being rechargeable, but I have not had to replace the batteries since I got it. I use it on the lower setting. I do use it everyday with the Pro-X cleansing wash which is not a foaming cleanser and it has micro beads in it for exfoliating. I know some exfoliating products recommend to NOT use everyday but this facial cleanser states that it is safe for everyday use.<br /><br />My nightly facial cleansing routine: Wash first with a gentle non-foaming facial cleanser (without the brush). Then use the Pro-X facial cleanser with the brush to wash for about 2 minutes. Rinse. Then I use Albolene to take my eye makeup off and to moisturize my face at night. (use Albolene at night only because it is really greasy). This routine, along with having the Pro-X brush has changed my skin's life!

  1704. I am a regular user of the [[ASIN:B0009F402K CLARISONIC Skin Care System 1 ea]], so I may be a little biased, but the people who think this is comparable may not have used the other brush.<br />If you are comparing in cost, it is about 20% comparable for about 15% of the cost.<br />The motion of the brush head is different- this one rotates and the Clarisonic uses a sonic pulse.<br />You have to replace the brush heads in both, and the Olay ones are about half the price of the Clarisonic.<br />With this brush, it seems easy to tear my face up, and with the Clarisonic it seems nearly impossible. I can use my Clarisonic brush on a daily basis, but I don't feel comfortable using this one more than a few times a week if I was using it regularly.<br />I also found it surprising that they recommend you use it (it actually comes with it) with an abrasive face wash, when my Clarisonic specifically tells you NOT to use it with abrasive cleansers. I'm kind of cringing at the idea of gradually tearing my face up with the abrasive cleanser and the brush.. not a pretty picture! I guess if you don't have sensitive skin and really need some serious exfoliation its OK??<br />Waterproofing- It has a gasket on the inside that makes it hard to replace the batteries, and over repeated battery replacements you would kill the gasket. The more expensive brand uses inductance to recharge, so it will never get water on the inside. I think this gasket would probably last you a year if you use the brush on a daily basis and replace the batteries regularly. I've been using my other brush for 2 years. Also, I feel I need to mention it was pretty tough for me to figure out how to replace the batteries. They have about a sentence on it, and it doesn't do justice to what a pain it really is, which is why I think this little gasket will actually wear out from the pressure fit.<br />I Actually think this brush is better to use on my body than my face because its pretty abrasive compared to my Clarisonic. I'm planning to keep it just for that.<br />All in all, I think you get what you pay for. If you are willing to make an investment and think a brush for your face is something worth springing for, go for the more expensive brand.p it just for that. All in all, I think you get what you pay for. If you are willing to make an investment and think a brush for your face is something worth springing for, go for the more expensive brand.

  1718. I bought the Clarisonic Mia and was using it for about 2 months when I started looking for something more effective. The Pro-x is battery operated, but I've been using it 2x a day for over a month and have not had to change them yet, as opposed to the Mia which had to be charged every 10 days. I use my Pro-x in the shower, but am a little more careful not to leave it under the water stream as much as I would with the Clarisonic. Also, while the Pro-x brush rotates it doesn't have the outer vibrating bristles that the Mia has, which I don't think makes a difference except it makes the Mia brush head a bit bigger than the Pro-x, but to make my Pro-x really effective sometimes I will move it in a circular motion in the opposite direction than the brush head is rotating. All in all, if you're looking for something that cleanses and exfoliates your face very effectively, then Pro-x is for you. I found it to be better than the Mia at a fraction of the cost.

NOTE ON INSTRUCTIONS I've notice that some comments state there are no instructions on how to take the battery case off or how often the brush should be changed. Instructions for both are on the side of the box. There are also instructions for how to install the brush head. I had no problem at all removing the battery cover or putting it together. For those who have tossed the box it says: INSTALLING BRUSH HEAD: Press the brush head onto the connection pin until it locks into position with a click. For best results, replace the brush head every 3 months or sooner if bristles become deformed. INSTALLING BATTERIES: Gently rock the battery compartment side to side while pulling to release the battery cover. Insert 2AA batteries aligning /- symbols. Replace battery cover. Replace batteries as needed. Do not mix old and new batteries as unit may be damaged.

  1788. Cleans my face the way I like it. Couldn't complain!
  1789. I'm reviewing the Pro-X because I also own a Clarisonic Pro and thought my opinion may be useful to some buyers. First off, I originally purchased a Pro-X at my local Walmart but then returned it after seeing the price of this one on Amazon. It was $15 cheaper on Amazon and included batteries and a second brush head. I also received a red Pro-X and not a white one as pictured in the product description. The red is attractive and I don't store my Pro-X out on my bathroom counter so the color wasn't an issue for me.<br /><br />I purchased my Clarisonic Pro (for body and face) about 11 months ago. I bought it on Clarisonic's website on sale. It came with a 2-year guarantee. Well it stopped working after 11 months. I called Clarisonic and waited over 30 minutes on hold before speaking to a Customer Service rep. Clarisonic replaced it but would only issue a new 90-day warranty, which was a little upsetting to me. If it stops working after 90 days I'm not sure if I would buy another one. Their customer service was really lacking. When I asked them why my warranty wasn't 1 year on the replacement device they told me that was because they only have a 1% failure rate. If they claim their failure rate is so low then why not provide a reasonable warranty on a product that I spent upwards of $200 on?<br /><br />I bought the Pro-X because I had to return my broken Clarisonic (they paid postage) and was waiting for them to mail me the replacement. My reaction when using the Pro-X for the first time was how different it is from the Clarisonic. The Clarisonic pulsates. The Pro-X rotates. Because the Pro-X rotates clockwise I found that I had to gently move the Pro-X in a counterclockwise motion or it would walk right off my face. The Clarisonic is clearly the luxury item with the Pro-X being the standard item but was the Clarisonic really that much better?<br /><br />For me, the question became, which unit better cleaned my face? To be honest, I'm not sure if the Clarisonic cleansbetter. In fact, I use the sensitive brushes on my Clarisonic and they still feel somewhat abrasive. I don't have sensitive skin but the Clarisonic feels very aggressive. I liked my Clarisonic best when using about it only about every 2 or 3 days. On the other hand, the Pro-X had a gentler brush which I really like. I grew to really like using the Pro-X during the 2 weeks I was waiting for my Clarisonic replacement. It was smaller, lighter and more gentle than the Clarisonic. I could use it every day without irritating my skin and I still felt that it was cleaning my skin and removing any dry or flaky skin.<br /><br />After about a week of using the Pro-X at least once a day, it really started to grow on me. As I said before the Clarisonic is very different and definitely feels like a high end luxury product, but I couldn't stop wondering if it was really a better product than the Pro-X. In the end, now that my replacement Clarisonic has arrived in the mail, I will continue to use the Pro-X and the Clarisonic alternating the two. If you're on the fence about which one to buy I would say if you have the money and like luxury items buy the Clarisonic. Keep in mind that because Clarisonic is so popular right now you may find their Customer Service really lacking if your unit stops working. But if you want a good cleaning brush for an affordable price then definitely go with the Olay Pro-X.

  1874. I could never afford the clarisonic facial brush, so I figured I would try the Olay one. Good choice, the brush is soft and I massage it all over my face...works wonderful. So glad I bought it:)
  1875. Fiddling with my skin isn't really my thing; a drug-store cleanser and moisturizer and I'm good to go. But sometimes gadgets just call my name, and this one did. I wish I could tell you ITS name--what is it, anyhow? Yes, an Advanced Cleansing System, but I wish it had a easier-to-grasp and more descriptive name. I suppose it's an exfoliator.<br /><br />Naming issues aside, it DOES have an easy-to-grasp handle, feels good and solid in the hand. It's got a soft, flat brush that rotates at two speeds, and it's easy to turn on and off. It runs on two AA batteries and getting that organized was a challenge: you have to guess where the batteries go, and the directions say \\"Gently rock the battery compartment side to side while pulling to release battery cover ...\\" There is no \\"gently\\" about it, you have to work hard to get it open.<br /><br />I found it odd that there was no product insert, only the rather brief instructions on the box. But once I got using it, I realized there's not that much more to say. You wet your face and the brush, use a bit of the cleanser that's included (or, of course, your own), turn the brush on and \\"gently move it around the face for approximately 60 seconds.\\"<br /><br />The entire .... cleansing system ... is supposedly shower-proof, which is why the battery compartment is sealed so tightly. I am not a fan of mixing batteries and water so I'm exfoliating at the sink, and will continue to do so. Running the brush over my face is quite relaxing and pleasant, not harsh at all as long as I pay attention. I don't know whether it's done anything dramatic for my skin, but it hasn't harmed it that I can see, and it's a nice bedtime ritual that makes me feel pampered.<br /><br />I can't compare it to any other product, but if you want a gentle massage and exfoliation without getting into it in a big expensive way, this Olay Professionals product is a good entree. I'm surprised at how much I like it.<br /><br />Linda Bulger, 2011

  1915. Anyone serious about skincare, whether you're 15 or 65, should really consider at least trying this Olay brush. As a female in her early 30s, I've tried so many products that have rarely made good on their claims. I wish I had tried this brush sooner!!! It is extremely gentle even on the higher speed (just be careful around your eyelids!), very compact, and does a near-perfect job of cleansing and polishing your skin (really should be used twice daily for the absolute best results). Skin is definitely rejuvenated, shiny from the cleaning, and amazingly soft.<br /><br />At the current subscribe-and-save price, this little baby is unbeatable and the negatives are pretty much completely forgotten about. That being said, this brush is by NO means a Clairsonic. The Olay brush bristles are very soft and are not available in a \\"deep clean\\" option (although the higher speed DOES get a little deeper into the skin). The brush also does not have a splatter guard as the Clairsonic does - this means that the higher speed splatters water a bit. Not a problem if you use this in the shower, but if you're in front of a mirror then it can be a bit of a hassle. I also am not really enamored with the way the brush sits apart from the base (maybe I received a defective model?). And while one could (and should!) choose rechargable batteries to use in their Olay brush, the battery compartment can be difficult to open (obviously intentional so that water doesn't get in).<br /><br />If Olay ever updates this product, or if I ever need to replace the entire gizmo, I will not hesitate to get another for myself. As it stands, I've already found holiday gifts for my mom and mother and sister in laws!
  1916. I am a 44 year old woman with sensitive skin with a touch of Roseacea. I really haven't had many skin problems. It gets kind of oily in the summer and kind of dry in the winter but nothing serious. I am on a budget and cannot afford a fortune on skincare. My main moisturizer is coconot oil. I have also been using a few drops of Bio oil as a night moisturizer and it has worked quite well. What I really wanted was something to clean my skin and exfoliate without irritating my Roseacea. I tried the Nutrogena Wave and was really unhappy with that. It really sucked and the cleansing pads were just horrible and hard to find to replace. I decided to give the Olay ProX. I am SO happy with this! The sample of cleanser is a decent sized sample and a little goes a long way. The brush has two speeds and does a very thorough job. It is waterproof, so I can use it in the bath or shower without worrying about it getting ruined. One of my favorite things is that I have the option to use any cleanser that I choose, not just Olay's, unlike the Nutrogena Wave. This machine really delivered what it promises. My skin got a deep and thorough cleansing. It is so soft, dewey and glowing. I really do like the cleanser that it came with. The exfolating beads are not too harsh and when my skin is properly exfoliated, my skin is much more receptive to any product that I use afterwards. This exceedeed my expectations. I am very happy with my purchase.

  1921. Only received my Olay Pro X three days ago. On the first night, I opened the thing up, put the batteries in and turned it on. Looking at it, I thought, \\"Well, this isn't going to be much, is it?\\" In fact, I took the batteries out and put them back in again, wondering if they weren't seated just perfectly or something. I'm not really sure what I expected; but the brush seemed to turn so slowly that I doubted its effectiveness immediately. After having actually used the thing, however, for three days now, I find that I like it quite well, and wouldn't want the brush to turn any faster. I do not like it well enough to imagine that I would ever want to spend more on a better replacement down the road; but if I continue to like it, I'd probably purchase another Pro X when this one has spun its last spin. One thing that really attracted me to this product--other than the low cost--was the fact that you can use it with any cleanser you like. I haven't yet tried the sample bottle of Olay cleanser that came with it. I guess I will sometime, but I'm kind of partial to my own soap, homemade with my choice of oils and other ingredients. Probably, I will do as I've read that several others recommend, and will limit my use of the Pro X to three or four times a week--after I've used it every day for a just a little while. It really does feel very good on my skin. The size is right, too. Easy to handle and store. One more thing, I don't get the problem people are having with opening the battery compartment. The directions are clear. Just read them, otherwise you'll probably be trying to twist where it doesn't twist--it rocks. Glad I bought it. :)
  1922. It is gentle, and my face feels adequately exfoliated. I have had a clarisonic previously and I like it just as much, and the value is better.

I felt as though all the pro-x did was push dirt around my face, as gross as that sounds. I got better results using an exfoliating cloth.   1926. Having never owned a Clarisonic, I can't really compare the two, although I based my decision to buy on another fantastic, in depth review given by a woman who owns both. She says the Olay is a great option for those disinterested in paying $100+. The most common complaints I read from other reviewers were as follows: the Olay version only has two speeds and it's too small. I occasionally read that others considered it to be too cheap and poorly manufactured, but that was pretty rare.<br /><br />Frankly, I am unsure as to why you would need more than two speeds. I prefer the faster of the two, but the slower is nice for more sensitive areas. They're both reasonable speeds and get the job done. As far as the size, I'm glad that it's so compact and therefore easy to tote around for trips. It is specifically made for the face, so for those wanting something larger they can use on other body areas, this is probably not right for them. However, I only wanted it for my face.<br /><br />I'm currently using the exfoliating cleanser sample that came with the brush, but will return to using the Olay ProX Acne cleanser I use when I run out. The exfoliating cleanser is very gentle and I have probably the most sensitive skin in the world. The combination of the cleanser + the brush makes my skin insanely soft! I can't really speak to how well it will take care of my adult onset acne, but I don't see that it will do any harm since it does such a great job of deep cleaning. I would highly recommend this item to everyone I know!
  1927. I have had this little gadget for about 2 months now. I honestly saw results the day after the first use. It unclogged pores I didn't know were blocked. As soon as you use it - especially the first time - you can really feel the blood circulating in your face. It's soft enough to not tug the skin, but powerful enough to do its job. It also helps to open pores in your face if you want to use it on your brows to pluck them. I have also used it using other facial cleansers with great results too. I keep mine in the shower, hooked behind the grip hand bar.<br /><br />I took it on a trans-Atlantic flight recently, just removing the head first. It was completely undamaged. The only issue is figuring out how to load the batteries, but the most popular review covers that. It takes a little more force than expected. I would recommend this to anyone, male or female. It could be very useful to teens as well.
  1928. This system and brush works well for me. My skin is on the dryer side of normal and feels smoother, but not raw, and looks more even after using the spinning brush head with an oil-based cleanser (not part of the system). I think my moisturizer does a better job of sinking in after using this.<br /><br />I came across this because I was looking for an exfoliation product. However, I can't compare apples to apples here since I've never tried the more expensive/popular brands.<br /><br />I use it about 2 to 3 times a week, mainly because it takes a little more time in the shower when i use this. The brush head lasts a pretty long time, i replaced it after about 100 uses (2-3 months). I haven't had to replace the battery yet. It has 2 speeds, but I've always used the faster of the two. I wish it spun faster.
  1929. Let me start out by confessing how much I love face brushes. I received this as a gift after already owning the [[ASIN:B001SERK9G Pretika SonicDermabrasion Facial Brush]] and Dermatouch Skin Perfecting System (also sold as [[ASIN:B004BASKAC g-maher Waterproof Rotating Face and Body Cleaning Kit]]).<br /><br />This can't really be compared to the Pretika because this one spins instead of vibrates. Compared to the Dermatouch/g maher/TEI Spa rotating brush, this one is smaller and less abrasive. I like that it is smaller and has the option of two speeds. The low speed is useless to me, but I would use it if I was able to use the pumice stone attachment from the TEI Spa brush set (doesn't fit....boooooooo).<br /><br />Olay really needs to step up to the competition and offer different textures of brush heads. This one is soft and gentle. I doubt that it exfoliates much, if at all. I used it one time to remove makeup and then followed with the Pretika. The Pretika brush head was still a beige color even after washing with the Olay brush. A firmer brush would do a better job at scrubbing. I can understand wanting to err on the side of being too gentle for the masses, but it sucks for people who are already used to using a face brush. I'm glad I have it and am not disappointed enough to try to return it, but am definitely eagerly waiting until Olay comes out with different brush heads. Then it will probably turn into my first choice face brush. Also, they could very easily and cheaply come out with accessories such as a simple stand and a brush cap to protect the bristles for travel/storage. I mean....even dollar store face brushes come with a plastic cap. Come on, Olay. Get to work!
