  1932. This is a great buy. Can't believe the Clarisonic could be any better. It's the basic soft brush attachment, but all I need.
  1933. This item is not what I expected. It is a very slow, weak motor powered by batteries with a flimsy brush. It did come with some facial cleanser which is nice but paying this much money for what I got was a disappointment. I would like to try the more expensive units but I fear they will be a letdown as well.
  1934. I was so excited to try this product; but, after using it my face is left red and irritated. I always use witch hazel after I wash my face and was dissapointed that makeup and dirt were left on my face after washing with this product. I don't think this is worth the $$ if it is leaving my face still dirty.
  1935. Overtime, it clean close to the pores. love it!! The only bad thing is that the head needs to be replaced every couple months.
  1936. Love it. you can go gentile or the faster speed on your skin. Completely exfoliates. I have a lot of acne and the faster pace sometimes rips the skin. but when my skin starts to dry and peel, it completely gets rid of it, and it cleans my face much better than by hands alone. I recommend it
  1937. If you are looking for a affordable alternative to the Clarisonic, this is it. It is effective in cleaning all the dirt and grime from your face using your favorite cleanser. It does not dry out your skin or leave it felling dry.
  1938. For me the Olay Professional brush is a downgrade so to speak. I bought and owned a Clarisonic for about a year, however after I went on Retin-A, the combination of the two products made my face really raw. I ended up giving away my Clarisonic to my mom a year ago. Having been on Retin-A for a year now, my skin has for the most part adjusted to it. However, I noticed that I had really stubborn clogged pores in certain areas of my face that just would NOT go away no matter what I did. My face cleared up tremendously with the Retin-A, except for those darn spots. I also noticed that my skin was looking rather dull and even using salicylic peels and glycolic peels weren't helping to exfoliate my skin. I considered getting another Clarisonic, but really who wants to pay $200 for something to wash your face? After seeing all the positive reviews here on Amazon, I thought I would try the Olay. I have to say I am impressed that a cleansing tool this inexpensive really does work and it is gentler than the Clarisonic. My skin looks fresher, the clogged pores have managed to stay unclogged (after initial help with an extraction tool to expedite the process), and it didn't break the bank. I've only been using it for a week, but I hope with continued use, my skin will stay clear!
  1939. I love this little gadget, money well spent. I may consider using another cleanser as the Olay cleanser tends to dry out my skin. This also works well removing eye make-up. Definitely recommend!
  1940. Great product! Daughter loves it!
  1941. my face never felt so good!!
  1942. I bought one for my husband and one for myself. Let me start by saying that the Olay Pro-X is working beautifully for my husband's skin. He has acne prone \\"normal\\" skin and this system seems to really deliver. Me on the other hand, I had such high hopes but it made my sensitive skin much worse. I have hormonal adult acne with lots of dry patches and i thought the Pro-X would really help get my face clean and buff away some of the dead skin. Well, it certainly did that. I was shocked with how clean my face was. But after 2 weeks of daily use, my face started to get really red and blotchy. It stung to put moisturizer on. My face was shiny (not from oil) and tight. Anything that touched my face made my face turn red and itchy. I have discontinued the Pro-x for about 2 weeks now and things are going back to normal. My dermatologist recommends Ivory soap and a baby washcloth which seems to be working just as well without the painful side effects. Anyways, all you sensitive skin people out there, use caution. Maybe use it every other day? or skip it entirely? If you have normal skin, I think you will like this product.
  1943. So much cheaper than others I have seen and works fine!
  1944. I have bought this same cleaning system 3 times. I love the way it works, but I use it in the shower (never fully submerged in water) and I have to replace it every year to a year and a half. It stops working or starts works very slowly. It's still cheaper than the Clearsonic so I would suggest buying this but be aware you may have to replace it sooner than later.
  1945. I absolutely love this and it works wonderful. Perfect power for rotation and not weak like I expected it to be. A steal of a bargain quality product compared to the similar $150 models sold through Macys. One of the best buys you could ever make.
  1946. This was well worth the money! It really helps to cleanse my face without being harsh or too abrasive. I love using it each night and my skin has never looked better. I use it with the cleanser it comes with occasionally but still use my basic cetaphil face wash with it and it works great.<br />The only negative I see is that because it is battery powered and it gets a lot of use, after a month I've already had to change the batteries twice.
  1947. I use it every night and love how my skin feels. Works great!!
  1948. I have used this Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System and NutraSonic. First I purchased a NutraSonic from Amazon years ago, and I loved the way it deep cleaned my skin and my enlarged pores and blackheads on my nose. I used it happily for quite awhile, and even a friend had noticed how good my nose looked, and I told her I was using a NutraSonic brush. After awhile my NutraSonic brush did not work anymore. When I pressed the on button, it did not come on or rotate. So I thought, ok, I just need to let it charge up. The NutraSonic plugs into a regular outlet to charge up, not a battery powered brush like the Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System. I let it charge for awhile, and it still did not work. I was so bummed because I had gotten such good results with it, but I did not want to throw it out since it was pretty expensive (not as expensive as the Clarisonic, I don't think,) but it was still an investment. I figured I could have my dad, who's good with electronics since he used to be an electronic technician, take a look at it and hopefully fix it. He did, after all, bring an expensive hairdryer back from the dead for me before.<br /><br />Anyway, in the meantime I wanted to go a cheaper route and hopefully at least get some of the same benefits as the NutraSonic. I checked on Amazon for something more affordable, and I came across this Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System. It got amazing reviews and a lot of reviewers said it performed as well as a Clarisonic, so I thought I would give it a try.<br /><br />The positive reviews are right. This Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System works just as well as my NutraSonic did. I was very happy with the performance and results. What you get in the box is the actual handheld device, a brush head that easily pops on and off the handheld device (they also sell brush heads separately so you can change those out when needed,) a small travel sized Olay cleanser, and 2 AA batteries. For the price, it is so worth it. The handheld device is on the smaller size, smaller than my NutraSonic brush, and it's pretty lightweight, even with the two AA batteries in it. Meaning you can brush and cleanse your face to your hearts desire without getting a tired arm. The brush head rotates, and the bristles are of the perfect density, not too stiff, not too soft. They get the job done well of deep cleaning (skin, pores, and blackheads,) and gently exfoliating the skin. The battery life lasts a long time, and it's nice that you can just turn it on and cleanse, unlike with the NutraSonic, where you have to plug it in and make sure it's charged up. The travel sized Olay cleanser included is a nice cleanser. It's got microbeads in it, which paired with the brush is great for gentle exfoliation and cleansing. I keep mine with my travel sized products so I can use it if I run out of regular sized cleanser or while I'm traveling. It's really handy to have on hand. I also love that since it is battery operated, it comes with 2 AA batteries! How thoughtful. I wish all battery operated things came with batteries included. The nice thing about this package is that the batteries are included in the package, but not physically in the handheld device, so you know that the batteries are new and fresh, not sitting in the device just dying. The bottom part of the handheld device is easy to push off and put the batteries in. I read in some other reviews that it was hard to open. I don't think so. You just have to know how to open it. Just hold the device with your non-dominant hand at the top of the device (the top part near where the brush head is attached,) and put your dominant hand on the bottom part where you see the separation is, and just pull down. It's not hard. It pulls right out, and you can put the batteries in. It's marked on the device which side is positive up and which side is negative up. Easy and done. :)<br /><br />I have actually gone through two of these Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing Systems now, andI still find that they are worth it. The first one I purchased after my NutraSonic died served me well. It fascinated my young daughter who loved turning it on and watching it rotate, and she \\"brushed\\" her hair with it while it was on and rotating. Since it was rotating, it got caught in her long hair and made some of her hair come out and it got twisted around the part where the brush head attaches to the handheld device. She also liked to give me \\"a makeup\\" which consisted of her turning on the brush and brushing my face with it gently (just the brush, no water or cleanser.) Since she got close to my hairline, some of my hair got tangled in the device too. So needless to say, she loved the brush. So much that due to her hair and my hair being tangled around the part where the brush head attaches to the handheld device, that eventually, the brush died. It was still dead when I tried new batteries. So I had my dad check it out. He opened it up and said that our hair caught around it made the motor burn out, and he couldn't fix it. So sadly, I threw it away.<br /><br />I was pretty bummed, and I thought my NutraSonic was still dead, so I had to look for another cheaper but still effective replacement. I also shop at Sephora, so I checked out their supply of facial cleansing devices. They don't sell NutraSonic, but they have all kinds of Clarisonics and other expensive options. I wasn't ready to shell out big bucks for another system, but I knew that my skin, blackheads, and pores needed something effective. So I tried a few of their cheaper offerings. First being the Boscia Konjac Cleansing Sponge with Bamboo Charcoal. That did nothing for my skin, pores, or blackheads. I mean, it cleaned my skin ok, and it was pretty cool since it was a natural sponge, but I needed something with oomph that provided results. Plus the back of the sponge tore and opened up where I held it to clean my face (no mechanism to hold it, since it's a natural sponge.) It just had a thin string looped through it so you could hang it in the shower.<br /><br />So my search continued. Next at Sephora I tried the Sephora Collection Precision Pore Cleansing Pad. I thought, hey, it says in its name it's good for pores. I was pretty excited to try it. It's a small oval rubber pad with a place on the back to hold it while you're cleansing the face, and it has short, little rubber nubs (like short bristles) over most of the surface with a small section at the bottom of raised circular things. I was pretty surprised how small it was, but I gave it a shot. Sadly, I found that it also did nothing for my skin, pores, and blackheads. It also cleaned my skin ok, but like I said, I need results. On the up side of this product, I found that given it's small size, it is perfect for cleaning behind your ears. Shamefully, I must admit that while I'm bordering on fanatical about the skin on my face, I don't pay much attention to cleaning behind my ears. That's changed since I found another use for this cleansing pad. It is very effective for cleaning behind my ears, and they have never been cleaner. :) I just put facial cleanser or body wash on the pad and clean behind the ears. So while I'll probably never use it on my face again, it has found a new life. :)<br /><br />So, back to Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System. After two failed attempts at trying to find a good, cheaper alternative to the results I desire, I finally broke down and came back to Amazon for this amazing system. Being an avid couponer, I was so happy to see that when I bought this system the second time, there was a digital coupon for $2 off this product! Yay! Sold! I have been happy with this Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System ever since. It provides the same ease of use and results that I had found the first time around. It still deep cleans my skin, gently exfoliates, and does great things for the pores and blackheads on my nose. I am happy.<br /><br />And, guess what?! My parents are visiting, andI plugged in my old NutraSonic for my dad to take apart and see if it's something he could fix for me. To my surprise, after charging up for awhile, I pressed the on button, and lo and behold, it started rotating! It's alive! After all these years, I was so surprised in a good way. Without my dad even looking at it! So I told him about it, and he said it was probably because the memory of the battery. I guess it had to be dead for awhile, charge all the way back up, then it would work again. Nice! So now I have my NutraSonic back, and I have this Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System! Win win!<br /><br />Bottom line, from someone who's tried a lot of different things, if you're on the fence about this product, and you need a cheaper brush that will provide results, just get this brush set. You and your skin will be happy with it. Good luck, and thanks for reading my review, I hope it was helpful.hang it in the shower. So my search continued. Next at Sephora I tried the Sephora Collection Precision Pore Cleansing Pad. I thought, hey, it says in its name it's good for pores. I was pretty excited to try it. It's a small oval rubber pad with a place on the back to hold it while you're cleansing the face, and it has short, little rubber nubs (like short bristles) over most of the surface with a small section at the bottom of raised circular things. I was pretty surprised how small it was, but I gave it a shot. Sadly, I found that it also did nothing for my skin, pores, and blackheads. It also cleaned my skin ok, but like I said, I need results. On the up side of this product, I found that given it's small size, it is perfect for cleaning behind your ears. Shamefully, I must admit that while I'm bordering on fanatical about the skin on my face, I don't pay much attention to cleaning behind my ears. That's changed since I found another use for this cleansing pad. It is very effective for cleaning behind my ears, and they have never been cleaner. :) I just put facial cleanser or body wash on the pad and clean behind the ears. So while I'll probably never use it on my face again, it has found a new life. :) So, back to Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System. After two failed attempts at trying to find a good, cheaper alternative to the results I desire, I finally broke down and came back to Amazon for this amazing system. Being an avid couponer, I was so happy to see that when I bought this system the second time, there was a digital coupon for $2 off this product! Yay! Sold! I have been happy with this Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System ever since. It provides the same ease of use and results that I had found the first time around. It still deep cleans my skin, gently exfoliates, and does great things for the pores and blackheads on my nose. I am happy. And, guess what?! My parents are visiting, and I plugged in my old NutraSonic for my dad to take apartand see if it's something he could fix for me. To my surprise, after charging up for awhile, I pressed the on button, and lo and behold, it started rotating! It's alive! After all these years, I was so surprised in a good way. Without my dad even looking at it! So I told him about it, and he said it was probably because the memory of the battery. I guess it had to be dead for awhile, charge all the way back up, then it would work again. Nice! So now I have my NutraSonic back, and I have this Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System! Win win! Bottom line, from someone who's tried a lot of different things, if you're on the fence about this product, and you need a cheaper brush that will provide results, just get this brush set. You and your skin will be happy with it. Good luck, and thanks for reading my review, I hope it was helpful.

  1964. I've only used this product 3 times. I've had it for 3 nights. So far, I really like it. I feel like it really cleans my face without irritating it or being harsh.<br /><br />I would recommend removing eye makeup first before using it. Because your eye skin is so sensitive, I don't use it around my eyes. The first time I used it, I hadn't removed my mascara (I usually just wash it off all at the same time)... Well this time I couldn't unless I was going to use my hands. I ended up with runny mascara on my face. So lesson learned and removed mascara and eyeshadow first the next day. Much better!<br /><br />Also, don't use a lot of pressure. Consider it more of massage for your face. Seems to work better when not pressed hard. Feels better too.<br /><br />Some reviews indicate it is difficult to get the batteries in. The box instructions say to rock the battery door compartment back and forth and it will come off. It was simple and not an issue for me.<br /><br />I wash out any left over face wash from the brush. I found that there is less residue in the bristles when you apply the face wash directly to your face than to the brush.<br /><br />Will update with further use.

I did not let water get inside but the humidity was too much for the inside of the machine. I would definitely recommend this for your cleansing regimen.
  1975. I bought this because I have dry skin that flakes and i wanted a way to scrape it off. Washcloths that I used to use would pull my skin and not get all the dead skin off. So this works pretty well, it just spins in circles and doesn't tug on the skin. I bought this to make cleaning my face more efficient and I believe this does the job. I don't give it five stars because it doesn't blow me away like I was kind of hoping for. But my skin is brighter and cleaner and I use this almost every day so I would recommend it.<br /><br />By the way, the tube of exfoliating stuff they give you is tiny, it looks bigger on the picture on the box than it really is, so don't be fooled like I was expecting a good sized tube.

  1986. I do really, really like this system. As another reviewer noted, the battery compartment is tricky to get to. However, it's worth it - I've had this about two months, and I can see an improvement in my skin.<br /><br />I tend to have very, very oily skin - especially if I am lax in my Retin-A use. I don't usually have whiteheads, however, I am prone to frequent blackheads and occasional cystic acne. The extra exfoliation helps my medicine reach further down in my pores, and I do notice an improvement in skin tone over the last two months. &#34;Icepick&#34; scars are still there, but discoloration seems better.<br /><br />However, it's not magic. You can use your favorite soap or scrub with it, so your mileage may vary. The included Olay cleanser isn't bad, but I won't be buying more. Because my skin likes to medicate separately from my cleansers, I prefer Cetaphil or gentle, salicylic acid-free soaps. And if you have delicate skin, I wouldn't use it more than once or twice a week.

My skin broke out again and this time worse than before. So I figure out it's the brush. Maybe the bristles are too harsh or there is something in them that breaks out my skin. Once I stopped using it, my skin recovered and went back to normal. Now I do not have a sensitive skin at all and this was the first time a product irritated and broke out my skin this badly. It's not the end all answer, but it was worth the money. She also uses it on her chest and back in the shower, which is helping the less severe breakouts she would get in those places. It is very easy to use in the shower and at the sink, doesn't make a mess (I was a little afraid it would be like an electric toothbrush and droplets would fly everywhere), and her skin is brighter. It's a good product for someone her age with acne, since she is not quite old enough to always want to clean her skin thoroughly, even though she desperately wants the acne to be gone.
  1993. I bought this for my 14 year old grand daughter to use because she has acne on her back and shoulders. so far she reports to me that it is awesome . She likes that she can buy lots of products to use with it......Olay made a good product here
  1994. For about three years, I have used St. Ives Apricot Scrub for my face. I love how it cleanses and makes my skin feel! Yet, I was curious about these facial cleansing brushes. Starting a new job was the added boost I needed to look my best. I ventured into Wal*Mart and found the correct aisle. I saw the Olay X-Pro and saw the value was great! I picked this one up and took it home. Later that night, I took my shower and then tried this baby out. I was shocked to see my skin afterwards. It was vibrant and silky smooth. It was easy to use and not uncomfortable at all. The bristles were smooth and did not hurt my sensitive skin. I used the included cleanser and loved it as well. I have used St. Ives Timeless Skin moisturizer for a few years and I can't give it up! So, I used it afterwards and the feeling was spa like!<br />I will also continue to use the St. Ives scrub off and on. I can't give it up either! :)
  1995. I have struggled with acne for a long time, and now into my adult years, I was sometimes embarrassed because of how my face looked. I have very oily skin, which has caused black heads, and white heads. For a while, I would just cover it up with make up, BUT NOW I am not afraid to go out with out make up because of this device.<br />I have tried so many products (proactive, dermalogica, prescription medications, microdermabrasions, etc.) And nothing gave me the results like the Olay pro-x brush. I was so hesitant about purchasing a spin brush, because some are very pricey, and reading reviews I could not tell if it was going to be another waste of my money. So after doing research, I went to Ulta (I didn't want to wait for shipping), and bought it, took it home and used it right away. It was so great the first time I used it. My face felt so clean! I couldn't wait to use it again. The box said to use it 2-3 times daily. I used it 3-4 times a day for the first week, just because it was very calming and relaxing. :) But now I use it no less than 2 times daily. My skin looks and feels amazing. I recommend this product to everyone. The best part is, you don't have to worry about charging it. I would rather spend a couple bucks on extra batteries, than worry about the device dying.<br />My skin is has improved drastically within a month of using it, and I now have added confidence! I am not ashamed of my beautiful skin!<br />The only thing I regret, is not purchasing this sooner!!!
  1996. I use this with my own cleanser, but it works very well. The bristles are nice and soft, and the two-speed function is great. Good quality overall. I definitely notice a difference with my skin being smoother and feeling cleaner.
  1997. Well made. Durable. would recommend.
  1998. It's OK, but finding rotating pads that fit well is difficult.
  1999. I am 29 and still prone to oily skin. I used this for the first time in the shower and there's no comparing this to a washcloth and soap! The bristles are soft (feels good on your face). It's a quiet, lightweight tool. Best yet, my face feels very soft and awake. In addition to sloughing off dead skin cells and daily buildup, it seems to also stimulate circulation.<br /><br />You probably would not want to use it too long (even if it does feel good) because I can imagine that it could be abrasive if over-used. Use it for 30 seconds and it'll be the best 30 bucks you ever spent on your face.
  2000. This thing does make my skin feel really nice after using it in the morning, but by the evening, I've noticed that I always end up with a few small breakouts. They don't last very long, so I'm not going to quit using it because of them. The tube of exfoliating cleanser that's included is pretty pitiful in size, but I'm finding that I like using the Pro X with my normal face wash better anyway, so I'm glad I went with this one for half the price instead of the one that you can get with the large bottle of cleanser. The bristles are very soft and comfortable on my face and I love that I can use it in the shower. All in all, I think this is a pretty decent affordable version of the Clarisonic-type electronic cleansers. Feels good without being hard on the wallet.
  2001. I had been considering buying a facial cleanser for a while but the cost was always a turn-off. I figured that I would try this one first and if I liked it I could always invest in a higher end product. Well, I've been using this for a couple months and don't see any need to upgrade. I was pleasantly surprised to see my skin texture show visible improvement after the first couple uses. Definitely a must-have.

I had been on two new topical prescriptions from my dermatologist (Retin-a Micro and Finacea) for about 1.5 months, and figured those would have purged my skin enough to not experience purging with this like I had before.<br /><br />Well, I'm sitting here typing this right now with a bunch of new acne all across my chin, with a few of those wonderful, beneath the skin bumps the size of M&Ms. Within two days of starting to use this product again, I began breaking out badly. Now, I used this ONCE per day at night, and after EVERY USE I soaked the head in hydrogen peroxide for at least 2 hours. I also wash my face with an antibacterial cleanser, which also should have helped reduce any bacteria on the head. This thing was more than clean - it was totally sterile! So that's not what was causing my breakouts. I can only assume it's too irritating for my skin. Bottom line is, I can't use this.<br /><br />Obviously this product has worked for many people, so I won't tell you not to buy it. Just be warned that your skin may not be pleased with it.

  2114. I had been driving several hours in hot Texas with the top down on my convertible and, of course, came home to a peeling forehead. I then used the pro-x machine with my own cleanser, which produced better results, but not great. I had a little bit of the Olay sample cleanser remaining, so I tried that with the pro-x machine and the results were A-mazing. The flakes just came off, producing a smooth, clean, face with no trace of peeling or sunburn. It was gentle, yet effective. I immediately purchased replacement brushes and cleanser on Amazon, and my face has been the better for it. I have not been convinced to change my toner and moisturizer, however, because the pro-x machine and olay cleanser seem to do the deed on their own. Great product!

For example, would a basic washcloth have the same scrubbing effect? (2) Also, is it really making our skin look better or is it the fact that we tend to wash our faces more frequently when we have a new product? I know if I could CONSISTENTLY keep up any routine, I would achieve the results I want without needing all the bells and whistles to do so.

  2171. Full disclosure: I am a man.<br /><br />I debated giving this a 3-star but ended up with a 2. I should have known better... the product is pretty much as advertised! Yes this is less expensive, NO this is not a replacement.<br /><br />Look, once it doesn't deliver the sonic component what are you really getting... a rotating brush. A rotating brush that is driven by two AA batteries. Wimpy. I am CERTAIN that I can provide a very similar cleansing experience with a face brush (which I am about to buy next) and a little elbow grease. I replaced the batteries that were sent with the product and put in some Lithium batteries; this, I fee, improved the performance and should make you less a slave to replacing batteries. It did not get rid of my blackheads, nothing will, but it does help removed dry skin. I do wish it had more power and would scrub a little harder but it is good if you have sensitive skin. I also have tried the Clarisonic and think the Olay Pro-X is just as good for much lower price. The Clarisonic scrubs a lot harder but is like 5x the price. I would say give the Olay Pro-X a shot before you go spend a lot of money on other similar products. Overall, I like this product but am not dependent on it by any means.

It couldn't possibly have been just a temporary purge, because I was getting clogged pores in places I never get them, like on my temples and above my upper lip. I had to stop using it. I'm glad it works for so many other people, though--it's nice that there's an inexpensive cleaning brush out there for those of us who can't afford to spend hundreds on one. And I would have been severely upset if I spent that much on a brush that wrecked my skin. No worries, though--I find I'm getting super-clean skin and great results with my Aqua Glycolic toner. And I've recently found another product for adult acne--Clearasil Adult Daily Clear, with resorcinol and sulfur--these two products seem to be doing what I hoped the Olay brush would do for me.

  2225. I purchased the Olay Professional Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System and have been using it for about 2 weeks now. I have dry, sensitive, over 50 skin. My skin actually does feel softer and smoother. I use this in the shower too on my legs and arms. I'll probably kill the little motor very quickly doing this, but that skin feels smoother, too, so I will continue. The item itself feels a bit cheap-the little motor sounds overly-taxed as you run it across your skin, as if it doesn't have quite the energy to keep working. But other than the sound, it works well. As other reviewers noted there are no instructions as to where to insert the batteries or how to open the compartment (end of handle) once you've found it (just keep pulling until it opens). All in all, I would recommend this to a friend. It is inexpensive and does what it is supposed to do. If it lasts for even 6 months I'll have gotten my money's worth out of it.

The clarsonic also has a self-timed shut off, but again, how hard is it to estimate how long one minute is? I use this bad boy in the shower to exfoliate in the mornings, and it does just fine. I don't press down too hard--just softly let it roll over my face. I see no downside to it, and the price is so much better than the clarsonic. It also comes with a small exfoliating scrub. It is pretty much like any of those other micro-bead scrubber fash washes. I'd recommend this to anyone who wants to exfoliate their skin to help look clean and keep acne at bay. I have to say that based on the way the product is constructed it was not hard for me to figure out that the bottom was removable, however, it did require a little bit of force to get it off. I use Avon Anew 2-1 cleanser and I have been using this since I was 19 and will never change it! I guess this may have been because it was digging out all the crap that had been in my skin lol - but by the end of my first week's use I was starting to get the pesky little whiteheads which is a sure sign of over-exfoliation. I love using it, but have now cut it back to using it only in the evenings when washing away my make-up.<br /><br />I can't say this is better than a clarisonic as I have never used it, but I have no desire to get one now, because it works so well. It may indeed have additional benefits, but my skin is now in the best condition it has been in almost a year and so I'm more than happy!!!<br /><br />MaameRose<br />X

I bought this in an attempt to establish a routine rather than always changing products and this thing has done wonders. It's gentle, yet effective. After a month of using I have minimal breakouts and my skin looks glowing despite the harsh Minnesota winter that lasts for 5+ months. It doesn't cause overdrying, irritation, and doesn't feel like it's tearing at your skin but leaves it smooth, soft, and refreshed. I switch between using my normal face wash with it and using the olay exfoliator that came with it to prevent &#34;overdoing it&#34;. For a fraction of the cost in comparison to some of the spendier version this is well worth the money.

The brush head is pretty small. The power is minimal. Press it too much on your skin and it will stop spinning. Doesn't take much pressure.<br /><br />I'd read other reviews and many people said they had a problem with the batteries. That was a really simple bit for me. Maybe they've changed the design, but I had zero problems with it.<br /><br />Look, what this comes down to is, to me, is that it's all just a trendy new beauty product. Know what works FAR better? Hot water, soap, a washcloth, and your own hands. Then finish it all off with cold water.<br /><br />Don't waste your money on this. ESPECIALLY do not waste your money on those brushes that cost over $100. That's a ridiculous scam right there.<br /><br />I use a Buff Puff and Dove soap. I don't get acne, nor blemishes. I got this brush because I figured as I was getting older my skin would change. And it has gotten more oily in the T-zone. But no one needs these brushes. Just don't bother.<br /><br />I can't emphasize this enough: Washcloth, water, soap. It's worked for centuries.

  2445. The Olay Pro-X Cleansing Brush is a great alternative and value to other high-end devices out there (aka Clairsonic). I'm fortunate to have decent skin to begin with, but I was looking for something that would help scrub off the excess oil and grime that would build up throughout the day. I have occasional breakouts, so I was looking for something to keep that at bay while not having to spend $100+. Using has it been great, and I have gotten a lot of compliments on the look of my skin and its texture. I only use it a few times a week, but I feel like that's enough. I've used the included sample exfoliating wash, which lasts a while, and alternate that with my regular face or anti-acne face wash (both are by Every Man Jack).<br /><br />The device itself is compact and battery powered, so it's easy to travel and not have to pack a charger. The brush is interchangeable, so you can replace it once it gets a little grimy like how you would replace your toothbrush. Since I don't use mine as often, I'm going on roughly six months on the same brush, and it's still in good condition. Although, I did purchase the extra brush heads, so I'll be ready when the time comes. Don't expect a variety of brush heads like Clairsonic, this one looks basic compared to the competitor, but I think it does it's duty.<br /><br />All in all, this a great product if you're looking for something to boost the efficacy of your usual face wash. It's very inexpensive, and depending on how often you use it, it can do your skin wonders. It's great for guys, too, so don't be turned off by the fact that it's made by Olay and generally marketed towards women.

Because of this, I usually use it at night before bed. Instead of a rotating brush, the brush vibrates sending sonic waves (much like a sonicare) into your skin as you rotated it around your face.<br /><br />To me, the pro x is comparible to the difference between using a regular toothbrush and then stepping it up to using a vibrating battery powered toothbrush. Then, the clarisonic would be like the sonicare. Sure, the pro x/battery powered tooth brush does a better job and makes a difference, but the clarisonic/sonicare simply does the best job.

The brush always helps remove dry skin effectively. I think the effectiveness is due in part equally to the cream and the brush combined. Use it in the shower when possible, especially if you plan on rinsing it during your wash or you'll get water all over the mirror. Be sure to also check for buildup of soap in the brush if you want the brush to last a decent amount of time. I've also found its really important to moisturize right after using the system or my skin tends to dry out pretty quickly. Overall this is a great product for the price.

  2560. Update after 1 year: I am still using this cleansing brush and I am just as amazed. I use it at least once daily with the Olay cleanser that came with it (I bought more). I also bought extra replacement heads, made differentiating marks on them with a permanent marker and now my sister and I both use the same cleanser. We just change out the brush heads when we use it. And even with two people using them so much, the batteries last very long. I only just changed the batteries for the first time last week. That is well over a year since I bought it. Amazing product at an even more amazing price. Definitely recommend!!!<br /><br />Product arrived as scheduled, packaging was really good.<br /><br />Now for the product review:<br />I think it does a very good job of removing dead skin cells and promoting new skin growth. Few weeks ago my mother commented that the skin around my mouth and chin was looking very dark. Looked almost like a goatee. That's mostly due to use of hair removal products from upper lip area and also acne scarring around my chin area. I decided to do something about it and after a little bit of research I decided to get this cleansing system.<br /><br />I use it once daily for about 5 minutes every night. I use the cleanser that came with it. I apply Olay Regenerist Regenerating serum after cleaning my face. I also wear an SPF product under my moisturizer during the day to prevent sun damage to the new layer of skin.<br /><br />It has been 10 days since I started using this and I can already notice 3 distinct improvements in my skin<br />1. A slight improvement in the hyper pigmentation around my mouth area.<br />2. I had a huge cluster of really small, microscopic pustule-like texture right under my lower lip that also seems to be disappearing.<br />3. The most impressive result of using this cleansing system is the effect it has on pores. Years and years of acne left really large and visible pores on my cheeks and in just 10 days, I can hardly notice any of them now.<br /><br />I know the improvement in my skin is not due to the serum because I have been using the serum since last year. I use that for the smooth feeling that it gives my skin but it was the cleansing system that has improved both the look and feel of my skin. It could be possible that the two products work better when used together. Please note that when I say two products I am referring to (1) Olay's Regenerating serum and (2) the cleansing system which includes the device and the face wash that came with it. I take it that the device was meant to be used with the face wash. I suppose people could use a different face wash if they wanted to but I think my results have been so good with the cleanser that came with it, I will stick to using just this for now.<br /><br />The bristles of the brush are very soft and not at all harsh, at least not for my skin. There are two speeds, I don't use the lower speed much because I feel it's too soft for my skin. I have used it in the shower without any problems. It came with with 2 AA batteries that are still going strong.<br /><br />Overall, I am very happy with this product and I ordered more of the sample cleanser that came with it. I would definitely recommend to others.

I use Burt's Bees cream cleanser, the chamomile bark one. I think a cream cleanser works really well with this product because the nature of the device is to exfoliate and the cream cleanser can keep the skin hydrated while that is happening, but that's just a personal opinion, no medical evidence. I have heard people using cetaphil and things like that too.<br /><br />If you are using this often, you are going to chew up batteries. Invest in re-chargables.<br /><br />Don't overdo it, use it only 2 minutes or so and only once a day, even less if you start feeling irritated. This is going to be different for everybody, just telling you how it is for my skin, which admittedly, is sensitive.<br /><br />I like that the replacement brushes are easy to find, but obviously the clarisonic has more types of brush heads to choose from.<br /><br />Overall, I like the product, it gets my face clean, but don't expect it to make your skin perfect overnight.<br /><br />Pros: Keeps skin soft, cleans out blackheads, easy to find replacement brush heads<br />Cons: chews up batteries, lack of different type brush heads, icky cleanser comes with it

I have rendered the cleansing system useless on my first use! after rinsing out the cleanser from my face, I found myself to be very red and blotchy. Unfortunately it is a common reaction for me with most cleansers, so I was not surprised that this did not work well for me. I was disappointed however. Waking up the next morning, I found that I had acne worse than I had ever had it before! this product completely clogged my pores, and caused a breakout in the likes I have never had before. Once again, I have sensitive skin, however I have never had a face cleanser cause acne before.<br />I advise anyone who is looking to buy facial cleanser, or a cleansing system, to be extremely careful of what they put on their skin.   2795. I have always seemed to be very cystic acne prone with extremely oily skin. I decided to buy this to try to see if I could clear my face up a little. With all of the great reviews and the great price I figured it was worth a try. However, I DO NOT use the exfoliating cleanser as I have extremely sensitive skin. I used my every day acne cleanser, Boscia clear complexion cleanser, which i would recommend to anyone with sensitive acne prone skin. ive had this cleansing system for about 2-3 months now and absolutely love it. The first time i used it i thought the bristles were a little too soft to do anything at all, but after a few uses it seemed to stiffen up a little bit and i could really tell my face was 100x cleaner and softer. I have used just about EVERY product on the market including a combination of 2-3 antibiotics a day and a prescription strength topical gel which did work, but bleached EVERYTHING and was really expensive. This is the only thing that has actually helped me achieve that beautiful flawless skin I've dreamed of all my life. I would recommend this to anyone as long as you can take the 10-15 minutes to actually use it. I absolutely swear by this thing now. Between the brush, replacements, and my cleanser, toner, and benzoyl peroxide over the counter medicine, I'm STILL not paying as much as I did for just one month of the prescriptions.<br /><br />UPDATE: December 2nd,<br /><br />I know this will sound cheesy, but this little thing has absolutely changed my life. Now that I've had this for awhile, I've learned the exact formula for my skin. At first I was using it every night along with a 10% benzoyl peroxide cream, spot treatment, and then moisturizer. For the first time in my life my skin was extremely dry and flaking everywhere. I ended up having to use an extreme aveeno moisturizer just to get my face back to normal. I am now using it every other night, and still use a lower dose of benzoyl peroxide but only on the nights I don't use the brush, just so I know I won't have any acne pop ups. I really wish I had taken before pictures. I had one side of my face that was really scarred and had dark marks everywhere from acne. It's almost completely gone with no use of scar reduction formula, just the brush. My skin is clear, and my pores are so much unnoticeable. Also, I've found that if you have a place that's more acne/blackhead prone, if you hold it still in that spot, it really gets down in the pores and cleans all of that out. This brush is 100% worth the results and then some. I'm finally not embarrassed to go out of the house with makeup caked on so people don't notice the imperfections as much. I have no imperfections anymore. And it's all thanks to this.sh, just so I know I won't have any acne pop ups. I really wish I had taken before pictures.   2909. It has been four months now since I purchased the Olay Pro-X. I absolutely love this product. I am 22 years old and don't have very problem skin, however I feel it is difficult to do a good job taking my makeup off at night. I have tried wipes, wash cloths, my hands, you came it. Nothing compares to the cleaning power of the Olay Pro-X. It came in a set, with a small trial size bottle of the cleaner as well which was nice, because the full bottle is a bit pricey so I wanted to try it first. The brush has two speeds which is nice because at first you will want to use the low speed until your skin gets used to the brush then in time you can go to the other speed if you wish. Even on the first day I could feel the deep clean happening. I ONLY use the brush twice a week to prevent any harsh side effects on my skin, but I love it. I look forward to the nights when I use my Olay Pro-X. I would for sure recommend this product to anyone who is interested. Well worth the money and you can usually find one on sale- either on Amazon or at Target.

It zapped off all of my makeup easily, and my witch hazel and [[ASIN:B000UVZU1S St. Ives Facial Moisturizer, Timeless Skin Collagen Elastin, 10oz]] afterward soaked in very nicely.<br /><br />After the first couple of weeks, my skin still looked calm and break-outs were somewhat reduced, but not totally eliminated. I then switched to the Simple gel cleanser, and the brush helps the gel turn into a light, frothy foam which feels really nice. My break-outs seem to be slowed substantially, and I haven't had any random skin irritation. The most effect I've seen is in my décollete, which definitely looks brighter and clearer than when I was using a basic shower pouf to cleanse.<br /><br />This isn't a miracle cure-all, but it does seem to be helping the effectiveness of my cleansers. That removes the bacteria that otherwise make zits come back when you use it again. If you don't wash it, I think that the bacteria and little skin bits stay on the brush, as I have definitely noticed that if i don't wash the brushead, next time I use it I will get a breakout.   2998. I've had the Olay Cleansing System for several months now. The best thing about this brush is that it does a great job of removing makeup. My skin has a lot of what I call \\"gook\\" although I think the correct term may be \\"blackheads\\" - so if I'm close to the mirror plucking my eyebrows I can see these tiny little white things (finer than salt) hanging out of my pores, which is gross. I gave it four out of five stars b/c this brush DOES NOT remove all the blackheads...which is surprising b/c I can easily pick them (quick swipe - no squeezing or anything like that) off with my finger. If I were to use it longer than the recommended 60 seconds or so (3-4 minutes) and put the brush at different angles, it can get them - but I shouldn't have to do that. I worry that using it for a prolonged amount of time and at different angles will just irritate my skin, so I decided to buy the clairisonic today. With the 90 day gaurantee, there is no harm in my opinion. I think you should get this depending upon your skin - if you have breakouts and blackheads - this will help, but it isn't going to get everything out without angling and prolonged use. It is definitely better than manual washing...if you have normal skin and just want something to get your make up off good, this is a great buy - and the price is worth it. You do have to be careful around the eye area as the thing has slid off near my temple towards my eye on several occasions. It is a little aggravating after using this thing and still seeing little blackheads everywhere, but for the makeup removal and price, I think it is deserving of 3 1/2 stars...but I'm giving it a 4 since that isn't an option.
  2999. I was a call away from going in for microdermabrasion treatment at my local dermatologist when I decided to break down and by this for $25. I'm so glad I did, I've been using it for about 3 days now, and WOW! My skin felt smoother after the first day, and visibly looks smoother on the third day. I have one of those 5x mirrors, so I've been able to really see how effective this product has been. So far I've just been using the exfoliating scrub it comes with, which has large granules; however, I plan using it with the Neutrogena facial scrubs. This product claims it makes exfoliating scrubs 7x more effective, and after using it twice a day I'd say I agree. The one thing that's a bit tricky is the batter installation. Some claim there are no instructions, and that they had to call the company. There are instructions, printed on the box, not in a pamphlet. Simply just wiggle the bottom side to side and it comes off real easy. Also, the brush heads are 2 for $8 on Amazon, which is much cheaper than the $20 for 1 they charge at Walgreens.

  3042. I have been using the Clarisonic for a few years now with great results but, after it took really nasty spill down the stairs while I was packing for a business trip I was in search of a cheaper option. I heard great things about the Olay Pro X so I gave it a shot. It DOES NOT compare to the Clarisonic on any level!<br /><br />CHARGING - The clarisonic comes with a neat charging dock that just magnetically snaps on. The Olay Pro requires batteries<br /><br />WATERPROOF - The Clarisonic is waterproof... the Olay Pro is NOT, it is water resistant. This basically means that the Olay can accidently get a little wet but, has to be dried off immediately. Seems really odd that they wouldn't make a device that is supposed to get wet, waterproof. I leave my Clarisonic in the shower and never had a problem. If water sits in the batteries in the Olay then the batteries corrode<br /><br />TIMING - The Clarisonic automatically turns off(you can turn it back on) at the end of the recommended cleansing time so you don't over cleanse your face. Olay Pro does not<br /><br />CLEANSING - Clarisonic \\" has 300 movements per second to gently, yet thoroughly remove 6X more makeup and 2X more dirt and oil than cleansing with your hands alone\\" The Olay Pro only rotates in a circle, no vibration. The bristles are also coarse and irritating to my skin. The Clarisonic gives you a better clean feeling. There is a reason dermatologists, estheticians and spas use the Clarisonic and not the Olay<br /><br />VERSATILITY - The Mia has several different options for cleansing brushes<br /><br />The Mia is about $119 and I have seen them on sale for about $80. I recommend you give the Mia a shot. If you feel it's not worth the price it is 100% refundable through Amazon. In my opinion, don't skimp when it comes to skin care. The Mia is by far a better product.

  3148. This product is the perfect tool to gently cleanse skin. My son is 15 and battling facial acne (as did I when I was his age) and my wife had bought him one of those well known products you've seen on TV - I won't mention the name because my intent is not to bash their product. But it didn't seem to be helping him that much, and costing us a lot of $$$. When I read the product's ingredients, there didn't seem to be any magic to it - just the same sort of common sense stuff you'd buy at the drug store to combat acne. So I surmised that its effectiveness was probably related to the discipline it instills in the user to treat acne. Since it makes you go through multiple steps, you're treating your acne with care. I figured I could replicate the same discipline by making sure my son did 2 simple things: a) clean his face properly twice a day, and b) apply acne cream every night before bed. So that's where this purchase came in - with this tool and a simple salicylic acid-based soap (that can be bought anywhere for very little $$$) he cleans his face, neck, and forehead in the morning and at night. The bristles are soft, it doesn't require a lot of pressure to cleanse thoroughly, and it's battery powered - simple! It's a great way to apply the acne soap. He loves it, and I have to say his face is looking really good. Of course acne never completely clears up until one gets past those teen years (at least from my experience), but his breakouts are much fewer and less severe. We liked this cleanser so much I bought one for my 12 year old daughter too. I don't believe controlling common acne has to be complicated, and this tool is a good weapon to have in the arsenal.

  3305. Now here's a product I passed right over for a long time because I could not imagine scrubbing my sensitive skin with anything - until someone with skin like mine, and who looked wonderful, told me to try it. I did. At first it did nothing and then about 10 days later, I began to have seriously improved skin texture, color, smoothness and even color. My skin no longer &#34;grabbed&#34; foundation or blush. The few small red areas and breakouts that I had attributed to hormonal changes disappeared and have never returned. The small lines seemed to fade (not altogether, as nothing does that). It developed a glow I hadn't seen in years. It felt good. I am such a fan! There is another product that costs $200 that does the same. I use it with the Pro X scrub and consider that essential. The entire Pro X line is hypoallergenic and I have super sensitive skin and it has never bothered my skin, so that's good to know. Neither is the amount of scrubbing too much for my very sensitive skin and in fact, it really does not scrub so much as just gently clean. If it abraded or was harsh I would have been a rashy mess and it didn't do that to me, even from the first use. I use it twice daily. In morning only short time and lightly with just a dab or Pro X cleanser, and at night I use makeup remover and then give my skin a thorough scrub with the Pro X cleanser. Morning and night, follow immediately with Olay Regenerist serum no fragrance and Regenerist no fragrance lines. Also good to know that you can use it under running water, so I got two, one for shower and one for sink. Uses two AA batteries. Heads are replaceable. My daughter in her 20s tried it and now all her friends are using it. This product does precisely as advertised. I am 64. This product is a wonderful addition to skin care for anyone. Teens will find it good for cleaning acne prone skin. Anyone who wants clean skin will benefit, men and women both. As one ages, exfoliation helps improve skin appearance and this little mild gentle scrubber, used daily, will do that perfectly.this little mild gentle scrubber, used daily, will do that perfectly.

  3336. The obvious comparison of this device is to the Clarisonic type cleanser. I would analogize this to toothbrushes:<br /><br />Olay : Clarisonic :: spinning toothbrush : Sonicare toothbrush.<br /><br />That is, the Olay is simply a two speed spinning brush head. The Clarisonic gives you that micro vibration buzz. The same thing with toothbrushes. The cheaper toothbrushes with a spinning brush head versus a Sonicare toothbrush that gives you that micro vibrating action.<br /><br />Depending on your needs, choose accordingly.

  3397. I cannot really conduct a scientific experiment here. Fortunately for me, my skin was not so awful that measuring improvements would have been practicable. But, where I use it, my skin subjectively feels much better.<br /><br />However, let me raise some issues.<br /><br />First, the box in which I bought the brush showed what seemed a much large bottle of exfoliating cleanser than actually came in the package. Not a shock if one read the contents, but still deceptive.<br /><br />Second, the device other than perhaps the brush-head itself is pretty simple and would probably not have been expensive to manufacture. We are basically talking about an electric engine, powered by two AA batteries, with an on-off button, and a second button to toggle between two speeds. If one can get a knock-off, such as that sold at CVS/pharmacy, for a meaningfully different price, then that knock-off might be the better buy. I say “probably” and “might” here because it is possible that Olay uses substantially better parts in its devices; but I doubt that. Where I would be more inclined to believe that the Olay product were truly superior would be in the brush-heads.

  3442. I was so flummoxed by the positive reviews of this product that I had to call my old English professor to find the best word to use that would accurately describe the situation.<br /><br />I'm a mid 20s guy with leftover scarring from a case of chickenpox (how is that still a disease btw) on the sides of my face. I conducted a whole afternoon of research into a good skin treatment system, and bought the Olay system based on the positive reviews.<br /><br />First off, know what you're getting into.<br /><br />If you think you're buying a relatively inexpensive microdermabrasion system (as it comes up in amazon search) that will reduce the appearance of scars and rejuvenate your skin, think again. The device has two speeds, slow, and a little slower. I was expecting some sort of soft orbital sander luffa type deal for your face, what I got was at best an oversize version of an electric toothbrush with softer bristles.<br /><br />Second, don't assume the magic is in the 50ml tube of the facial cleanser that comes with it.<br /><br />Seriously was that the smallest bottle they could find? I even bought the extra 2 bottles of detoxifying pore scrub that amazon recommended. Another dead end. No different that any other less expensive cleanser on the market. In fact I'd submit that most other cleansers are better.<br /><br />So what is it good for?<br /><br />If you're someone who has to clean their face a lot for whatever reason (e.g. make up, acne, oily skin, blah dee blah) this product would make it slightly easier to clean your face if you didn't have say, a wash cloth around, or failing that, a paper towel with some cleanser.<br /><br />Also, it makes it fun to wash your face while simultaneously drawing attention to areas of your complexion some should pay more attention to (e.g. pores, blackheads, etc. )<br /><br />Other than that I would say boo Olay for this piece of garbage.
  3443. I don't own a Clarisonic brush but I don't think I need that big of a brush anyways for that big of a price (over 100 bucks and don't get me started on the investment for the refill brushes). I have never really had bad skin and not the type to break out all over the face. My traumatic experiences involve one huge pimple on the chin or around the nose every now and then, but overall my skin is clear of acne. This Olay brush would be helpful for people like me that do not experience facial or body acne issues often. I don't recall having to change the battery yet and its been a year! I noticed it slowing down and I thought it was the battery dying but false alarm and it went back to normal speed the next day! I like it for the small, portable size (which you can take with you easily for travel purposes) and easy to hold in hand in the shower. I recalled watching \\"The Drs\\" show and they mentioned this brush being just as good as going to a professional clinic and getting the microdermabrasion (THAT IS IF YOU USE IT EVERYDAY AND DO IT CORRECTLY- you can achieve similar results as doing the professional thing for so much less). I personally feel my skin looking and feeling better with the brush exfoliating my skin everyday and probably helps absorbs the face wash and face creams. If you're on a budget, this product is trustworthy with it's brand (I know there are a lot of knock-offs of the Olay brush) and it should do its thing just as well for you if you just need a little boost in your skincare routine. The refill brushes should be around 10 dollars for a pack of 2, which is decent.<br /><br />By the way, if you think you clean your makeup off well...check again and use the brush to really get into your pores and you might possibly see makeup residue!

  3472. I'm not really impressed with this product. While it does what it does clean and exfoliate I just don't think it's worth it because it does not do a better job than the multitude of exfoliating cleansers on the market. Think about it. Why pay $20 for a tool when you could spend the money on a cleanser that makes your face just as smooth and clean and not have the additional costs of replacement batteries and brush heads. Besides, you will still need to use the Pro-X with a cleanser!!! I also think that some people are very pleased with this product because if they follow the directions they are washing their face for a whole minute which might be longer than they normally take to cleanse. If you take a whole minute to clean your face you will get clean and if you are using a microdermabrasion cleanser you will get smooth. It's that simple.<br /><br />I've read a lot of reviews saying that the Pro-X causes redness or irritation on their skin. My combination skin is only sensitive to chemicals and has no problems with abrasion or breakouts. For me, I would prefer something a little more powerful. I actually feel that the speed is weak--even on the higher setting. I get better results by just using my hands. Still, everyone has different skin.<br /><br />One thing I do like is that you can use the Pro-X in the shower; however, the payoff is that the battery compartment is so incredibly hard to open. I had to find YouTube videos on how to open it and I still almost gave up. I think it might be impossible for some people to open if they have arthritis or any other condition that affects hand strength.<br /><br />The cleanser that comes with the Pro-X is pretty much on-par with other microdermabrasive cleansers I've tried. I've used this Olay version both with and without the tool (got the same result either way) and it's pretty decent. I've used other products where I was able to use less of the product and get more exfoliation because this one contains less \\"grit\\" but again my skin can handle more grit whereas others who are more sensitive to abrasion will find this cleanser to be just right.<br /><br />I'm rating the Pro-X with two stars because I just don't think it's cost effective. I have to buy a cleanser either way and notice no difference in the results by using the tool. That said, the product does deliver on its claims. It just does it no better than using an exfoliating cleanser on its own.

  3476. I first bought this in January 2011, not long after they were released. I had been looking at the Clarisonic but could not afford the high price tag. I have large pores, that tend to clog easily and form lots of blackheads and no exfoliant on it's own has ever been able to solve the problem, so I bought this. This cleans so well and yet the bristles are so gentle. I have never felt like my skin was getting raw unless I used it for too long or pressed too hard.<br /><br />Last week, it died and I was devastated. This has been the best skincare purchase I have ever made (and as someone who has oily skin, prone to breakouts, I've made a lot of them). Regardless of the cleanser I use it with, my skin has been smoother, cleaner, and my pores diminished. In the week I have been without it, blackheads have already been forming on my face again. My face feels rougher and oilier without it. Thus I ordered a second one.<br /><br />The first lasted over two years with daily use and I only had to change the batteries once in all that time. I actually think the only reason it died was because I changed bathrooms and it was in near direct water in the new shower. This brush is water-resistant, not water-proof, but I got a new shower rack and the new one will stay clear of the shower spray. Even if one of these dies every two years, you would still have to buy 5 of these at Amazon's present price to cost as much as one Clarisonic, which is ten years of use, and I guarantee one Clarisonic wouldn't last ten years.<br /><br />tl;dr-- Great for your skin, great price, well worth it.

(I test-drove a friend's for a week once.) I've used the cleanser that this kit includes, but even my usual face product (Philosophy's Purity, if you're curious) works extra hard with this brush. I've used it over my lips in the shower too, which was accidental, but worked out well - almost as well as my usual lip scrub. :)<br />I've used this both in the shower and at the sink with no issues. I do recommend wiping/drying the brush after each use, especially after use in the shower.<br />I do wish the brush head was a little bit bigger, but that's only to save time in my morning routine. Overall, this is an excellent product that works well and does wonders for my skin! I've noticed clearer, healthier skin as a result, and I've had to use less moisturizer after using the brush. The moisturizer soaks into my skin quickly too. That'll help stretch the life of my moisturizers!<br />I love the two speeds, though I tend to use the faster one more often. The brush is almost like a massage for your face, which is amazing to use in the midst of a migraine or headache. Bonus!

  3534. I love this product. I am going to be 41 next month and although my skin looks much younger than my age, I was starting to notice larger pores, sun spots, and very fine lines. The dermatologist diagnosed it as mild Rosacea. Any moisturizing product that is applied after cleaning absorbs quickly and much more thoroughly than before. It's as though the cleaning brush has prepared my skin to absorb the moisturizing product. I have used this faithfully twice per day since I received it (almost one month) and am overjoyed with how much my skin has improved. It seems like with each passing day my skin looks better. When I put my foundation on in the morning it makes my skin look flawless...just like it used to do when I was in my early 20's. No more foundation pooling in pores or caking in fine lines. In fact, about two weeks after starting to use the product a woman walked up to me in the grocery store and told me I had beautiful skin. I was speechless. I didn't know what to say. I thanked her and immediately sent a text to my husband, who is using the product faithlessly (LOL,) and told him what had happened. I am very happy with this product and recommend it highly.<br /><br />I am using other Olay products (cleansers and moisturizers) with this product. I was using the same products before - the only change to my skin care regimen is using the Olay Pro-X Advanced Cleansing System twice per day.<br /><br />I saw some reviewers mentioning their scrubber stopped working because they were using it in the shower. I have used mine in the shower twice per day for about a month and have no problems so far. Of course, I don't wet the unit and I turn away from the spray of the shower to clean my face. When I'm done cleaning I remove the brush and run it under the water and use my damp hand to wipe off any soap from the unit. Water never penetrates the unit. I then dry it with my towel and put it in the medicine cabinet.<br /><br />If you're on the fence about purchasing this item, I say go for it. The price is very reasonable in comparison to other items or treatments on the market. It's easy to use and only takes about a minute two times per day to get amazing results. I used to miss washing my face at night on occasion (lazy, too tired, etc.) but since the results from this product have been so positive and so quick, I actually look forward to cleaning my face and applying my moisturizer because I can't wait to see how nice my skin look and feels in the morning.<br /><br />I plan to buy one for my 23 year old daughter and my sister-in-law so they too can enjoy the benefits.er day.<br /><br />I saw some reviewers mentioning their scrubber stopped working because they were using it in the shower.   3646. So the moral of the story... great product, but it depends on how your skin will react. I couldn't give Olay a &#34;1 star&#34; for the product if it might be my face that doesn't react well.<br /><br />I bought this a bit ago and I pretty much use all Olay products on my face. There is nothing wrong with the function and the actual piece of equipment is great. Olay has created a solid product for a great price. The bristles are soft and the spinning is effective. I use it in the shower and it has stood up to any water penetration, so it is definitely water proof.<br /><br />I would have given it 5 stars, but I had to pull back one, just for the sake of drawing a little attention to the review and to explain people that it is a great product, but might not be for everyone.<br /><br />It is not the product's fault, it is more how my skin reacted. The first week I used it, my face broke out. I had weird pimples in places that I didn't know would surface on my face. I figured it was because I was scrubbing up some nasty dirt and exfoliating better than I ever had before. My skin, after the pimples cleared, looked beautiful. It minimized my pores and made it look super smooth and even. BUT... a week or two later, it broke out again. I don't normally get a lot of pimples... maybe one here or there, but since I've started using this product, it has changed.<br /><br />Right now, I'm battling some new pimples that came up recently (pretty sure it's the same reason) .. and they either are big red bumps that don't have heads to pop (such as a lot of crap coming up from way underneath the skin) or a lot of little ones that can be quickly taken care of.<br /><br />I'm not completely giving up on the product, because I really like it and when my skin is happy, it looks flawless; however, if I keep getting break outs, I will have to stop using it. I guess for some it might be perfect, or others, it is a nightmare (I've seen some reviews). I am trying to not use it everydayor switch up the days I use it, in hopes that it gets better. It was originally recommended by my derm, but every skin process is not for everyone.
  3647. Great product. My skin before using this product was dry with occasional outbreaks. Now, my skin is softer and more radiant. I use it twice a day with my own cleansing product. Highly recommend.

  3652. I was disappointed in this little gizmo. I was looking for something to help keep the dead skin removed, to exfoliate, to stimulate circulation for a better complexion, but in fact, it worked the opposite. The spinning brush is very very soft . . .like a baby hairbrush, and the spinning action is weak enough that if you apply a little pressure, it merely grinds to a halt. Thus, it doesn't really get the face clean AT ALL. In just a few days, dead skin started building back up, oiliness increased, my complexion appeared dull and muddy. Not clean or radiant. I had been doing better with a soapy washcloth and my fingertips and have returned to that method.<br /><br />The little tube of exfoliant product seemed to work well enough, but was a very tiny amount . . . you might say, a sample.<br /><br />As for its good points: it fits the hand nicely, is waterproof to use in the shower, is lightweight and quiet. Just not effective.

Have been using it for close to a month now, and the batteries have yet to run out. I have sensitive yet oily skin, and it works great on me. Would certainly recommend this product to everyone!
  3744. For the price, it definitely makes my skin feel cleaner. The brush head itself could be made softer as other reviewers have noted. Unlike other reviews, I do not use this in the shower so I cannot comment for in-shower use. I've also adopted using the brush with other facial cleaners that I prefer to use. Decent product for the price.
  3745. I like the brush a lot, and it's not hard on the skin at all. The cream with it is nice too.
  3746. This cleansing brush is ok. Can't really tell much of a difference between the low and high settings. I can't really tell if its cleaning deep down in my pores either, but I guess for the price its pretty decent. The bristles are very soft.
  3747. I use this brush twice a day with the tea tree face wash from the Body Shop, my skin feels much better and the acne has reduced drastically. PS: I follow up with a toner and face cream from the Body Shop
  3748. The electric brush works well. It's comfortable to hold, seems to apply the cleanser well, and doesn't irritate my face.<br /><br />I can't determine anything about the cleanser from the minute amount that comes with in this package. I use the brush with other cleansers.
  3749. this was a wonder purchase for me. I started using it right away and can already tell a differency in my skin.

  3751. I ordered this product on saturday and received it today which is tuesday June 25th. My first day using it and it made my face so soft. Another thing I liked about it is it took any foundation I had left on my face. Usually I have to scrub my face at least three times just to remove makeup. I would reccomend this product.
  3752. I know I shouldn't be so excited about washing my face, but with this I just can't help it :) My skin feels softer and smoother after I have used this. I combine it with Cetaphil for a gentle, but thorough clean.
  3753. I bought this for my mom for Easter. I had purchased a cheap 10 dollar one prior for her to try before I bought a better one to see if she actually liked it and would use it. The only thing I wish this came was the other attachments (if I would have read the description more closely, I would have spent the extra 5 dollars and purchased the toilettree brand because it not only comes with over 5 diff attachments but it also has a much larger handle which I like). This was still great for my mom and I like that it was has two speeds. It also came with a sample of the face wash they make (however I make my own exfoliant scrub using sugar, olive oil and lemon juice).<br /><br />Overall, for the price especially compared to the Clarasonic, I was satisfied.
  3754. bought this as a stocking stuffer for myself. It works great, just wish that it came with extra heads. Make sure you order extras.
  3755. I love this little thing! I had doubts about these facial brushes and actually snickered whenever commercials came on. Now that I'm pregnant I've developed large patches of really dry skin under my noise that I couldn't get rid of and wearing foundation to cover the redness only made the dry skin stand out even more. I bought this in a desperate attempt to feel better about my skin and I'm delighted to say it's one of my favorite purchases! It scrubs just enough to get dead skin off but not enough that your face feels raw or over-scrubbed.
